title: Rockstar Executive Assistant / SMM / GHL Expert needed!
description:
(Instructions to apply are below) My name is Kayla, and I am looking for an amazing rockstar Executive Assistant / GHL Expert for my friend Dr. Christine Anderson!



I am not an agency, you will be working for and paid directly by Dr. Christine. My role is simply to help her find a rockstar, and once we find the perfect fit to place with her I will be out of the picture. (But here as support if either of you need me!)



We have found some fantastic tea
mbers in the Philippines on my team, and I am on a mission to help some of our good friends in our business circles find the same without having to go through typical agencies.



Dr. Chris is an amazing entrepreneur. She is extremely sweet and kind, and would be a joy to work with! She has been a Chiropractor for many years (specializing working with kids) and is excited to bring a new line to her business offering laser work for weight loss and other benefits. She is very creative, energetic (you’ll see videos of her below doing aerial silks!) and loves being successful in business. 



You can read more about her and her business at:




 



As you can see, your help with managing her social media and posting content regularly will be greatly appreciated!



We are looking for a new Executive Assistant / GHL Expert to join her team full-time! You'll be in charge of keeping everything in the business organized, in line, and running smoothly. You’ll also be in charge of all things GHL. Creating pages, funnels, marketing systems, managing the contacts,
s, all the things. She would also like someone who is comfortable in teaching her about GHL so she can understand it better.



She will also have you helping with social media, calendar management,
 management, and other EA tasks.



You will be working directly with Dr. Chris, and she is looking for someone who is proactive and will consistently look for more ways to help, rather than just waiting to be told what to do.



I love a good assistant who sees me doing something or needing something, and then tells me “Hey, I can do that for you! Would you like me to take that off of your plate?” That is the kind of person we are looking for!



The hours would be on a US schedule, Mon-Fri from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm Pacific time, with an hour lunch. (She personally likes to work a split shift, so if that is your preference that can be discussed.)



We need someone who:



* Has a love for organization, lists, calendars, etc., and is good at keeping things organized in a way that others can understand and access when needed

*Has experience working with GHL, and is extremely comfortable with the software

* Has a minimum of 3 years experience working in the same or similar position

* Is proactive, and will regularly look for ways to be helpful rather than just waiting to be told what to do

* Is comfortable jumping right in and being self-sufficient

* Is very reliable, organized, trustworthy, and can keep private information private

* Has a backup internet plan (like a hotspot) if the internet goes down, and a back-up generator/battery if power goes out

* Is comfortable using AI tools, and sees the benefits in using AI to get amazing results

* Has some experience doing light video editing

* Is comfortable and excited to learn new softwares

* Has a positive attitude, takes feedback well, and implements things that you learn

* Is detail-oriented, and takes time to double check your work to make sure it is correct

* Loves to give 110%, is interested in a full-time, long-term career, and growing with an amazing, positive team. Someone who always goes the extra mile, not someone who does just enough to get by

* Is comfortable working on TimeDoctor (similar to TimeProof) – it won’t be used to micro-manage, but rather just the opposite as a simple verification tool.

* Is comfortable and happy working from home on your own with minimal supervision

* Is comfortable asking a lot of questions for clarity rather than guessing, and will communicate right away if there are any issues, concerns, or questions



We are looking for someone who wants to stay with her long term!



To apply:



Please send me (Kayla) an
 to 
 with the subject line:



"I'm **YOUR NAME**, Dr. Chris’s new Executive Assistant / GHL Expert!"



Please include your resume attached as a PDF, as well as a direct link to your personal profile here on onlinejobs.ph, and please answer the following questions:



1- What did you like most about your previous job(s)?

2- What did you dislike about your previous job(s)?

3- What you would like your next job to look like? What is most important to you about a new job that you take?

4- What experience do you have that will help you excel in this position?

5- Are you looking for a long-term career working exclusively with one company? How many hours would you like to work per week?

6- On a scale from 1-10, with 1 being passive and waiting to be told what to do, and 10 being proactive and finding things to do without being asked, where would you rate yourself?

7- On a scale from 1-10, how would you rate your organizational skills?

8- On a scale from 1-10, how would you rate your attention to detail?

9- On a scale from 1-10, how would you rate your comfortability and ability to manage and complete multiple tasks?

10- What is your experience with Go High Level?

11- What is your experience with social media management and video editing?



Please also include:

12- What does your internet/computer situation look like at home? Do you have a reliable computer, fast internet, and a back-up solution if there is a power-outage during your shift? (keep in mind most of your hours worked will be in the middle of the night)

13- Are there any days and/or hours during the week that you are not available to work?

14- Have you ever worked during US hours before? Is that a schedule you enjoy?

15- Are you comfortable working on TimeDoctor?

16- What about this position excites you the most?



We look forward to hearing from you!



P.S. It's not often that the opportunity comes along to work with a company where you get to define your role and grow with that company as an important, key tea
mber. If this appeals to you, then follow the instructions to apply today.

title: Assistant Support to the CEO
description:
Position: Assistant Support to the CEO



Location: Full Work from Home (Remote)



Type: Full-time (9:00 AM - 5:00 PM PST)



Ready to support a visionary CEO in a fast-paced, high-energy environment?



At Audate Media, we are a marketing agency and SaaS company helping entrepreneurs grow through automation, media, and consulting. Our core products—Progreda, WebinarCore, and Dollar Leads—help coaches, consultants, and agencies generate leads and increase client retention. We’re looking for someone who uses AI tools to increase speed, quality, and scalability, and who’s excited to help a fast-moving brand grow from the inside.



We are looking for a detail-oriented, proactive, optimistic, and fast learner to join our team as the Assistant Support to the CEO. This role is crucial in ensuring smooth operations, assisting the Executive Assistant and the CEO, and helping the company stay on top of its fast-moving game. If you're highly organized, quick on your feet, eager to learn, and thrive in a dynamic setting, this is the perfect opportunity for you. You’ll be a key part of our mission, and your multitasking skills and passion for your work will drive your success in this role.



Responsibilities:



Assist the Executive Assistant & CEO: Provide seamless support, ensuring operations run smoothly in our fast-paced environment. You’ll be working closely with the Executive Assistant and sometimes directly with the CEO, helping to support their day-to-day tasks and strategic goals.



Calendar Management: Assist with confirming calls, meetings, and appointments, keeping the CEO’s calendar efficient and organized.



Event Coordination: Help plan and support events, ensuring logistics are on point.



Book Speaking Engagements & Podcasts: Coordinate and secure speaking engagements and podcast appearances to boost the CEO’s public profile.



Personal Assistance: Support personal tasks, making the CEO’s life easier both at work and at home.



Event & Partnership Coordination: Help facilitate partnerships and coordinate exciting events to strengthen relationships.



Marketing & Social Media Support: Assist with content creation, posting, and social media management to amplify the company's online presence.



Other Tasks: Assist with any other tasks that may be assigned by the Executive Assistant or the CEO as needed to ensure smooth and efficient operations.



What We’re Looking For:



Proactive: You anticipate needs and stay ahead, especially in a fast-moving environment.



Leader & Team Player: Comfortable taking charge when needed, while collaborating effectively with the team.



Honest & Trustworthy: You’ll handle sensitive matters with discretion and integrity.



Goal-Driven: You’re focused on both personal and professional goals, striving to grow and improve.



Fast Learner & Quick to Act: You adapt quickly, thrive under pressure, and get things done fast.



Creative & Full of Ideas: You bring innovative ideas to the table, helping the company stay ahead.



Detail-Oriented: You have an eye for detail and ensure nothing is missed, even in a fast-paced environment.



Optimistic: You stay positive and keep the energy up, even when the pace picks up.



Multitasking Skills: You juggle multiple tasks with ease while staying organized and focused.



Works with Passion: You bring enthusiasm and energy to every task, contributing to the team’s success.



What You’ll Gain:



Growth Opportunity: Work closely with the CEO and Executive Assistant in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.



Exciting Challenges: The role will constantly evolve, offering opportunities to learn, innovate, and grow.



Team Collaboration: You’ll be part of a team where every contribution counts and your voice is heard.



Ready to thrive in a fast-paced environment?



If you're ready to take on the challenge, bring your detail-oriented, optimistic, and fast-learning energy to a fast-moving company, apply now!



To Apply: Send your resume, a cover letter, and a video introduction to 
 your video, tell us why you are the perfect fit for this fast-paced role and how you’ll support the CEO in every way possible!



Please make sure to include "Assistant Support to the CEO" in the
 subject line.

title: Transaction Coordinator
description:
Dannecker & Associates Closing Assistant



The Closing Assistant role at Dannecker & Associates involves overseeing all administrative and compliance details of real estate transactions, working to ensure a smooth closing process for our team and their clients. This position requires acute attention to detail, organizational and administrative skills, as well as the ability to be resourceful and solution-driven.  Our mission is to improve the lives of others by ensuring the very best experience when buying, selling homes and investments. We strive to achieve this experience by incorporating Dannecker & Associates’ Core Values into each interaction: Do the Right Thing, Thirst for Learning, Quality and Focus, Spirit of Winning, Collaborate without Ego, Fun & Laughter, Resourcefulness.



Core Responsibilities:



Transaction Management: Oversee the entire contract to close process, ensuring all deadlines, contingencies and CAR/Compass requirements are met.

Document Handling: Handle the preparation, review, execution and tracking of a large volume of real estate documents (contracts, disclosures, addenda, reports, escrow documents, etc.), ensuring accuracy and brokerage compliance.

Brokerage Compliance: Navigate Compass Business Tracker platform to validate the accuracy of all transaction documents, working with the Compass Compliance team to ensure each file adheres to all local, state, and company regulations, overseeing the lifecycle of the Business Tracker file from open to close.

File Maintenance: Maintain meticulously organized files, keeping the Google Drive and Business Tracker up-to-date. Perform file audits. Follow all closing procedures upon the conclusion of each escrow to ensure proper database management.  

Special Projects: Embody a growth mindset to expand your skillset and navigate new projects as team needs expand. Crosstrain with various departments as needed.

Continuing Education: Stay informed and educated on all form updates and evolving brokerage requirements.

Oversee the Full Transaction Lifecycle: Utilize Glide for the preparation/completion of seller disclosures upon the receipt of an executed Listing Agreement. Manage all administrative and procedural steps from the 
nt a contract is executed until the final closing date.

Deadline Tracking: Meticulously track and manage all contractual deadlines and contingencies.

Problem-Solving: Proactively monitor transaction progress, identify potential issues or delays, and work with relevant parties to resolve them efficiently before they impact closing.

Zillow: Actively manage the Zillow system; Prepare Invoices, and close out all Zillow Preferred transactions by each deadline. 

Communication: Serve as the central point of contact, providing timely communication for agents, clients, lenders, title/escrow companies and teammates.  Much of the communication is via
 so proper English writing skills are a must.

Real Estate Agents (our team): Provide file audits, answer process/compliance questions, and ensure all necessary documentation is completed and conveyed in a timely manner.

Clients (Buyers/Sellers): Collaborate with Buyer/Sellers to ensure all broker documentation is received, reviewed, and fully executed in a timely manner. Assist with any non-sales-related communication, redirecting/providing a warm handoff to any party within the transaction, as deemed applicable. Provide deposit and contingency removal updates. Order Home Warranties (buyer-side escrows) and provide Utility reminders. 

Cooperating Agent/Transaction Coordinator: Create a collaborative environment to ensure the needs of each broker file are met, and communication is properly documented. Request contingency removals for seller-side transactions. 

Title/Escrow: Deliver necessary documents, coordinate signed commission instructions and escrow amendments, and verify settlement statements.

Lenders: Monitor loan progress, provide required documentation, and track loan commitment milestones.

Finance: Provide the finance manager with prompt updates on accelerated close of escrow dates, agent credits, purchase price changes, sales manager approvals, Modifications (MT-BR or MT-LA) and updated Zillow invoices as applicable.

Follow Up Boss: Update stage, make sure transaction is input as sold, update new address, remove old address, update close date.  Update notes on client.

title: Amazon Associate Manager (Product Research & Sourcing) / VA
description:
Read Full Job post before applying. 



We’re looking for a reliable, detail-oriented, and proactive Amazon Associate Manager to support the growth of our Amazon business through product research and sourcing. This role works closely with leadership and plays a key part in identifying, validating, and preparing product opportunities for launch.



This position is ideal for someone who already has hands-on Amazon experience and is ready to take on more ownership, accountability, and decision support while still being coachable and open to direction.



Key Responsibilities

Product Research & Validation (Core Responsibility)

Conduct in-depth product research to identify profitable Amazon opportunities

Analyze key data points including:

Sales rank, review volume, and ratings

Pricing trends and margins

Competition levels and barriers to entry

Identify niche gaps and underserved markets

Track seasonal trends and demand shifts

Review competitor listings and pricing strategies

Propose product differentiation ideas (bundles, variations, private label angles)

Prepare clear, data-backed product recommendations for leadership review

Calculate and present ROI, break-even points, and profitability using spreadsheets

Product Sourcing & Supplier Support

Research and compare suppliers via Alibaba or other sourcing platform

Evaluate supplier credibility, pricing, MOQs, and lead times

Support communication with sourcing agents when needed

Help shortlist reliable suppliers for potential product launches

Ensure product ideas are launch-ready from a research and sourcing standpoint



What We’re Looking For

Prior experience as an Amazon VA, Amazon Specialist, or Associate Manager

Strong background in both product research and sourcing



Comfortable using tools such as:

Helium 10

Jungle Scout

Keepa

Strong skills in Google Sheets / Excel

Highly detail-oriented and organized

Trainable, coachable, and receptive to feedback

Able to take ownership of tasks and follow through independently

Clear and professional communication skills

Able to manage time effectively and meet deadlines



Work Hours & Availability

Part-time to full-time (to be discussed)

Must be available to: Attend required team and strategy meetings

Maintain 2–3 hours of daily overlap with the CEO for collaboration and updates



Rate: $9- $10/hour Depending on Experience



Tools You’ll Use

Helium 10 (Black Box, Xray)

Jungle Scout (Product Tracker, Opportunity Finder)

Keepa

CamelCamelCamel

Google Sheets / Excel



Why Join Us

Direct exposure to decision-making and leadership

Clear processes with room to improve and optimize

Opportunity for long-term growth and expanded responsibility

Stable role with consistent work for the right candidate

If you’re confident in product research and sourcing, comfortable working closely with leadership, and ready to step into an Associate Manager role we’d love to hear from you.



Fill Out this form to be considered:

title: US Recruiting Coordinator (Sourcing)
description:

Recruitment Support

title: Client Prospecting / Research Specialist
description:
(this is a 2-3 week contract with potential for more ongoing work)



The Opportunity

We're attending two trade shows in Mexico City and need someone to research exhibitor companies BEFORE we arrive:





Your job: Turn a list of company names into a organized database with detailed research on each company.



What You'll Actually Do

Your Daily Work (8 hours/day):

Step 1: Company Research 



Visit company website

Check 
pany page

Identify what they do (manufacturer? distributor? brand?)

Find key decision-maker (owner, director, export manager)

Get contact info (name, title,
, LinkedIn URL, phone)

Note certifications (ISO, GMP, export licenses)

Screenshot or save key info



Step 2: Categorize & Document



Assign company to one of 6 business categories (we'll train you)

Rate priority (High/Medium/Low)

Add all findings to Google Sheets

Flag for follow-up if needed



Step 3: Report Progress



Update daily tracker

Note any challenges or questions

Highlight interesting discoveries





The 6 Categories You'll Assign Companies To

We'll train you on these, but here's the overview:



Bucket 1: Sourcing ClientsMedspas/distributors who BUY products; Medical supply distributor looking for better prices



Bucket 2: Private Label ProspectsPhysicians wanting their own branded line;Dermatologist with Instagram following selling products



Bucket 3: White Label Partners; Manufacturers who can produce for us; Contract manufacturer offering OEM/ODM services



Bucket 4: Distribution Clients; Brands needing help entering/exiting markets; Mexican skincare brand wanting to expand to Asia



Bucket 5: Consumables Buyers; Clinics buying treatment supplies regularly;Spa buying wax, gloves, microneedling cartridges monthly

Bucket 6: Not a Fit; Companies not relevant to our business;Beauty schools, media companies, injectable brands



Don't worry - we provide detailed examples and you'll have weekly check-ins to clarify.



Example of What Your Research Looks Like

Before (what we give you):

Company: Vmed Mexico

After (what you deliver):

Company: Vmed Mexico

Website: 
 (example)

LinkedIn: 
/company/vmed-mexico

Business Type: Medical supply distributor

Key Contact: Maria Rodriguez, Operations Director

: 

LinkedIn: 
/in/mariarodriguez

Phone: 
Products: Medical aesthetics equipment, consumables, skincare

Certifications: ISO distributor, COFEPRIS registered

Export/Import: Imports from USA, Europe, Asia

Current Market: Mexico nationwide

Bucket: 1 (Sourcing Client)

Priority: High

Rationale: Regional distributor importing aesthetic products - 

          potential client for Asian sourcing to improve margins

Next Action: Outreach recommended



What Success Looks Like



companies researched and documented 

 Daily progress reports submitted

 Mid-week check-in call

 All databases finalized and reviewed

 Top priority contacts highlighted for both events

 Handoff documentation prepared

 Final check-in call



Required Qualifications

Must-Have:



Strong research skills - you know how to dig for information online

Attention to detail - accurate data entry is critical

Self-directed - you can work independently with minimal supervision

Organized - you're managing lots of contacts and information

Comfortable with Google Sheets - this is where you'll document everything

Professional Spanish and English preferred - you'll be reading websites in both languages (translator plugin would probably work)



Nice-to-Have:



Experience with B2B research or lead generation

Familiarity with LinkedIn for professional research

Understanding of cosmetics/medical spa industry

Experience with Mexican business culture

Based in Mexico or familiar with Mexican companies





What We Provide

Tools & Resources:



Complete exhibitor lists with  company names

Google Sheets template with all fields pre-built

Detailed research guide with examples

Training call to explain the 6 categories

Weekly check-ins to answer questions and review progres



Support:



Training call in first 2 days

Weekly 30-minute check-ins

/WhatsApp for quick questions (response within 24 hours)







Work Schedule

Standard full-time schedule:



8 hours/day, 5 days/week = 40 hours/week

2 weeks total = 80 hours minimum project



Flexibility on timing:



You choose your 8-hour work window each day

Must be available for check-in calls (we'll schedule times that work)

Daily progress report due by end of your work day

Responsive during your work hours for quick questions



Example schedules:



9am-5pm with 1-hour lunch break

8am-4pm with lunch break

10am-6pm with lunch break

Split shift if needed (4 hours morning + 4 hours afternoon)





How to Apply

Send the following to [your
]:

1. Resume/CV

Highlighting any research, data entry, or B2B experience

2. Cover Letter (max 250 words)

Answer these questions:



Why are you interested in this role?

Describe your research process - how do you find information about a company?

What's your experience working independently on detail-oriented tasks?



3. Research Sample Exercise

Pick ONE company from this list and show us your research:

Choose one:



Laboratorios Dibar (Mexico)

Sesderma (Spain/Mexico)

Pacific Pharma Group (Mexico)



Provide:



Company website


pany page

Key contact (name, title, LinkedIn profile)

What they do (2-3 sentences)

Contact
 (if you can find it)

Which of the 6 categories you think they belong in and why (2-3 sentences)



Format: Simple text or bullet points - spend max 20 minutes on this

Subject line: "Trade Show Research - [Your Name]"

title: Customer Support and Data Operations - Accounts Payable Automation Software
description:
LeapAP is an accounts payable automation software focused on property management, based in Canada, and serving clients in the US and Canada.



Our team is small, but has previously built leading SaaS and fintech companies. There are many opportunities for growth, mentorship, and greater ownership for someone who's interested in startups, property management, accounting, and fintech.



We're looking for someone to join our operations team to execute in one or more of the following areas:



1. Data: validating/correcting automatically extracted invoice data, processing of received invoices that our system couldn't process automatically, mapping global vendors from our system to those of our clients in their property accounting systems.



2. Customer support for our software via our
/ticketing system. Our users are primarily property managers, property accountants, management company head office staff, vendors, and board members.



3. Utilities: assisting with various operations relating to our utility portal invoice auto-retrieval system.



The role is full-time (about eight hours per day), scheduled during our Eastern Time business hours. The start date is March 12 2026.

title: We're Hiring: Bookkeeper (Real Estate)
description:
Do you have a sharp eye for detail and a passion for keeping numbers balanced? We’re looking for a Bookkeeper who thrives in a fast-paced, growth-driven environment and wants to be a part of a team that’s transforming real estate through innovation. 



This is your chance to join a goal-oriented and supportive team where accuracy, organization, and accountability make all the difference.  



If you’re looking for perks and other payoffs: 



1. Healthcare Package 

2. Annual Performance-Based Pay Increase 

3. Flexible Paid Leave – we trust you to balance focus and rest 



And you have what it takes to be successful: 



1. Strong organizational, verbal and written communication skills (Your “clients” include both Skymount and out stakeholders) 

2. Solid experience in bookkeeping or accounting, preferably with general real estate bookkeeping exposure 

3. QuickBooks Certification (required) and strong working knowledge of QuickBooks, Excel, and accounting systems 

4. Familiarity with classes and projects in QuickBooks (huge plus) 

5. Self-discipline, excellent time management, and resilience under deadlines 

6. A strong problem-solving-mindset, because you won’t just enter numbers, you’ll help identify financial issues, propose solutions, and work alongside leadership to keep projects on track 

7. Ability to work at least 6 hours per day on the night shift. 

8. Confidence in working independently while communicating clearly and collaborating with the team when needed. 



Then you can easily ace these duties and responsibilities:  



1. Recording daily financial transactions with accuracy 

2. Maintaining and reconciling accounts, ledgers, and bank statements 

3. Preparing invoices, track payments, and manage accounts payable/receivable 

4. Generating financial reports to support decision-making 

5. Collaborating with the team to ensure compliance and smooth operations 

6. Keeping clean, well-organized financial records 

7. Supporting audits and tax preparation when needed 



But wait, there’s more! (Not something you have to ace, to be honest) 



>Desktop/Laptop (i5 or Ryzen 5+, 8GB RAM minimum) 

>Dual monitors for multitasking 

>Windows 10 or newer 

>Stable internet connection (75+MBPS + backup connection) 

>Noise cancelling headset 

>Quiet, dedicated home office 



If you think you’re the one we’re describing here, then don’t just stare at your screen and grab this opportunity to be one of us! 



TO APPLY: 



Respond to this post 



Use Vocaroo to answer the following questions. Attach the link of your recording (NOT MORE THAN 5 MINS.) to your response or
. 



1. Imagine a client’s account doesn’t reconcile at the end of the month. Walk us through how you would approach fixing it. 

2. If you notice a financial or inconsistency issue that could impact leadership decisions, how do you communicate it? 

3. Do you prefer working independently or collaborating closely with a team? Why? 



Send us a copy of your latest resume for our reference. 



WE’RE LOOKING FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU! 



-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

WHO IS SKYMOUNT? I’ll give you a better one, WHY SKYMOUNT? 

 

At Skymount, our culture is more than buzzwords—it's grounded in deeply rooted values that shape every decision we make and every relationship we build. We believe in People First, always putting empathy, humility, and humanity above ego. Whether it's a teammate, a client, or a seller, we treat everyone with dignity and lead them with kindness. We live by a Growth Mindset, both our business planning and our daily showing up— challenging ourselves to learn, evolve, and become better versions of ourselves, both as individuals and as professionals. Radical Transparency is part of our DNA; we believe in open and honest communication to build trust, even when the discussions are difficult. And on the hard days (because they inevitably do exist), we dig in and tap into our Grit—refusing to give up, regardless of the obstacle in our way. These aren’t platitudes on a wall; these are the standard we hold ourselves to and the energy we bring to all we do. We don’t just work at Skymount—we live out our values together.

title: Senior SEO Strategist – Local Businesses & Google Maps Focus
description:
We’re Hiring: SEO Strategist for Local Businesses



We’re looking for an SEO strategist who can help a range of local companies from engineering firms to local shops and service providers, succeed in search. We need someone who’s not just ticking boxes, but actually building a repeatable, scalable system as we grow.



You’ll own the SEO strategy end-to-end for multiple local clients. That means diagnosing why a site isn’t ranking, designing the fixes, and leading the execution. If you have experience with Google Business Profile optimization and local map rankings, that’s a definite plus. We want someone who’s proactive, organized, and comfortable taking ownership. You should be able to communicate clearly in English, explaining not just how to do things, but why they matter.





In the long run, we want you to grow into a leadership role, helping to manage a small SEO team as we expand.





Key Responsibilities:

Full SEO ownership for diverse local businesses.

Diagnose issues (technical, content, local relevance) and implement solutions.

Execute local SEO strategies focused on real results (leads, bookings).

Handle keyword research, content planning, on-page optimization, and technical SEO audits.

Align SEO efforts with our overall offers and growth goals.

Help us build clear, repeatable processes and eventually lead a small team.





Must-Have Experience:

Proven SEO success with local businesses across different industries.

Strong technical, on-page, off-page, and local SEO knowledge.

Ability to create strategy, not just follow one.

Clear English communication skills.

Working Arrangement:

Full-time, remote, must overlap with hours similar to Singapore/KL/Philippines time zone.





If that’s you, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Travel & Content Creation Team – Join Me on the Road!
description:
Kamusta po! I am Jon, an American travel vlogger with a total following of over 900,000 across YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, and
. I’m currently building a small in-house team located near Pasig to join me on my travels and help with recording, editing, and many other parts of the content creation process. My goal is to build something that feels less like a traditional job and more like a close-knit team that grows and travels together.



We’ll start by focusing on localized short form content around 20-70 seconds long with minimal editing (mainly jump cuts and occasional blur effects). These videos usually take about an hour from start to finish, so we’ll aim for around 3-6 unique videos a day to repost across 8 different social media channels. Afterwards, we’ll begin to branch into long form content as we prepare for the first set of longer travels.



You do not need to have a lot of experience in content creation, and it’s totally okay if you’re shy around cameras. I was the same way when I first started making videos too. I’ll be working closely with you and teaching you everything step by step — all I ask is that you’re open-minded, willing to learn, and excited to grow with the team long-term.





There will be a 3-part interview process:

1. Online Conversation – We’ll start by chatting here or on Google Chat to clear up any misunderstandings and to begin learning more about each other.



2. Video Call – Just a casual call to see if we get along. (Background noise like chickens, jeepneys, or karaoke is totally fine — I’ve been living in the Philippines for over a year now, so I’m used to it)



3. In-Person Meet-Up & Casual Recording – We’ll meet up and do a short, relaxed recording together to see how our personalities work in real time. (Nothing scripted — just natural conversation)



If all 3 parts go well and both of us want to proceed, we will then spend around 2 weeks working closely together for training, building a workflow, and preparing for upcoming trips. During our travels, I will cover the costs for food, housing, transportation, and general travel expenses. In addition, each tea
mber will receive a direct percentage of my top-performing channel’s revenues. This is paid work, and all details will be discussed transparently during the interview process.







In conclusion, I’m looking for people who want to:

- Join me on my travels

- Help with all parts of the content creation process

- Grow together as a team



What’s included:

- Paid role (revenue share from my top-performing channels)

- Food, housing, and travel expenses covered during trips

- Connections with brands and sponsors

- Hands-on training and real-world experience

- Opportunity to grow long-term with the team



Interview process:

- Short online chat

- Casual video call to see if we get along

- In-person meet-up with a short, relaxed recording (nothing scripted — just natural conversation)



Requirements:

- Open to learning new skills

-  Positive, team-first attitude



Preferred (not required):

- Video editing experience

- Social media experience

- Located near Pasig



If this sounds like something you’d be interested in, send me a message and answer this question:

- If we were traveling together and just finished filming all day, what would you do to relax?



Thank you for taking the time to read this — I’m really looking forward to building something incredible together as we travel, create, and entertain the world!



- Jon

title: Need Video Editor for Short Form Content
description:
Need an editor to help make engaging short form boxing content. We currently have an audience of roughly ~80,000 viewers and rapidly growing. I need someone and in the future a team of people to help manage to massive amount of content I’m going to be generating.



By ourselves we generate roughly 10-20 reels on average a day and need someone who can keep up with that same volume if not more.



A lot of my content is informational and motivational. It’s about learning from your mistakes in boxing and doing your best to improve. 



You have options for creative freedom in generating this content but it must be kept clean and not include any elements that may damage our brand image.



If you perform high quality content and become a consistent member of the team there is options for scalability as well grow and more appropriately monetize our channel.

title: Full-Time (VA) Virtual Assistant & General Operations Manager (+ Tasks, Pitching, Data Entry, Calendar Coordination, and
description:
Full-Time (VA) Virtual Assistant & General Operations Manager (+ Tasks, Pitching, Data Entry, Calendar Coordination, and Lead Management)



**If you have applied to a similar role before, please apply again! As there are new requirements, bonuses, and job description updates**



I’m looking for a rockstar Virtual Assistant & General Operations Manager to join our team full-time! If you're the kind of person who loves keeping things organized, engaging with people, and making sure no lead slips through the cracks—you might just be our perfect match.



In this role, you'll be handling everything from client engagement to pitching opportunities and tracking leads, helping us stay on top of our game. We need someone who's detail-oriented, proactive, consistent, reliable, and loves bringing a little fun to the workflow.



Sound like you? Let’s chat! 



The company is Manifesting Serenity. Mainly focused on content surrounding Travel, Sustainability, and Wellness - If those align with your interest and values, then that's even better!





Company Overview – Manifesting Serenity 



Manifesting Serenity is all about travel, sustainability, and wellness, offering a blend of mindset shifts, digital resources, group trips, events, and more to inspire adventurous, conscious, and fulfilling experiences. Whether you're looking to explore new destinations, embrace sustainable travel practices, or cultivate a mindset that empowers you to live boldly, we’re here to support your journey.



Through 100s of travel guides, digital products, and immersive experiences, Manifesting Serenity makes it easier than ever to explore the world in a way that aligns with your values—thoughtfully, courageously, and in good company. Because travel isn’t just about where you go, but how you experience it.





—-----------------------------------------------------------------



Disclosure #1: Most tasks are flexible. But there are some tasks that will need to be done between 5am - 9pm PST/ Seattle time. For example: Responding to podcast opportunities, reaching out via messenger to those interested in coaching, etc. 



Time Conversion Tool - 



Disclosure #2: This position requires experience and confidence. But just remember you’re presenting my vulnerability, not yours! So, you’ll need to be confident in being able to get me more bookings, traction, assisting me to get contracts, and clients. I will supply steps, some training videos, and platforms. But there’s still a foundation of confidence needed for this position! 



I’m glad you’re here and ready….Let’s dive into the rest: 



SOME TASKS

• Daily message and comment engagement through all social media platforms,
s, and more for lead management and pitching.  (Interactive, thoughtful listener, and genuinely caring attitude.)

• Casually selling packages, services, products, and upgrading the conversation’s direction.

• Responding to B2C
s

• Pitching B2b
s and following up, alongside tracking leads.

• Actively taking notes of FAQ's and noting them down for future content creation

• Creating and setting up automatic response templates on social media platforms for more timely responses. Of course, editing the templates to make them unique to that person as well.

• Tea
etings via video chat with leader(s) of the company

•
 Marketing Campaigns

•
 updates to partner companies

• Watching company updates and training videos

• Actively thinking and implementing more ways of becoming time efficient with tasks & responses

• Future responsibilities: active comment responses for webinars, courses, etc.

• Highly organized and excel at staying organized within Google Sheets documents

• Content Creation - Social media posts,
 marketing, presentations, etc. 

• Social Media Design

• Inputting Analytics and data tracking

• Helping book podcast appearances

• Organizing Google Sheets

•  Event posting, lead follow up, and 

•  and more! 





SKILLS:

• Timely but in-depth responder

• Active listener

• Productive, results-oriented task manager

• Has professional in-depth knowledge of platforms:
 Messenger, Gmail, etc.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills (Advanced English or greater required)

• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

• Must be great with people and excel at digital communications and follow up

• Experience pitching book signings, podcast features, speaking events, cold client pitching, etc.

• Experience in event coordination a plus



*IMPORTANT*

• Be a self-starter and hold yourself accountable - I’m looking for someone who takes initiative, holds themselves accountable, stays consistent.

•  This role is best suited for self-led contractors who do not require external motivation or frequent check-ins. (I already work 60+ hours a week, I’m looking for assistance to reduce that load.)

• Must be honest and do honest work - no slacking, watching TV, on your own socials, or even clocking double time. Any dishonest or lazy work will be marked fully unpaid and the role will be terminated immediately.

• Failure to be communicative or show up for 48 hours when scheduled to work will result in termination. 

• Advance notice for time off is required - Must provide at least 24 hours advance notice for any time off. Failure to do so may result in unpaid time, reduction of hours, or immediate termination of this agreement

• The role is Monday - Friday, any missed days cannot be missed or changed for another day, if you miss a day, then it goes missed and naturally unpaid. Very simple. 



If you're serious and don't waste people's time, let's work together! 



PS: As long as there’s respect, I’m fun loving, full of laughter, smiling and ready to get going!





SPECIFIC SKILLS VIA ONLINE JOBS PA:

• Virtual Assisting

• Customer Support

•
 Support

• Admin Assistant

• Excel

title: Python/Back-End Developer
description:
About the Remote Contractor Role



We’re looking for a Backend Developer to help build and scale the API layer for our quiz-based mobile application. You’ll primarily work in Python (Flask) to design and implement APIs consumed by a Flutter mobile app, integrate with our database, and use OpenAI / ChatGPT to generate quiz content that is stored in the database and served back through API endpoints. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys solving complex problems, navigating ambiguity, and using AI tools effectively to work through challenging technical situations.



Key Responsibilities

- Design, build, and maintain RESTful APIs using Python and Flask

- Build API endpoints consumed by a Flutter mobile application

- Integrate with OpenAI / ChatGPT to generate quiz questions and content

- Store generated quiz questions in the database so content can be reused and queried efficiently

- Work with relational data models supporting quizzes, packs, users, attempts, progress, and analytics

- Be comfortable learning and working with databases, including tables, relationships, and queries

- Ensure APIs are secure, stable, and well-documented

- Collaborate with product and mobile/frontend developers to ship features end-to-end



Required Skills & Experience

- Strong experience with Python

- Hands-on experience building APIs using Flask or similar frameworks

- Solid understanding of REST APIs and backend architecture

- Experience working with databases (schema basics, querying, relationships)

- Ability to navigate tough technical situations by effectively leveraging AI tools

- Familiarity with integrating third-party APIs such as OpenAI

- Ability to write clean, maintainable, well-documented code



Nice to Have

- Experience with PostgreSQL

- Experience with Supabase (Postgres, Auth, Storage) – Postgres/Supabase is a plus

- Flutter experience (nice to have)

- Familiarity with authentication, rate limiting, and API security best practices

- Docker, deployments, or CI/CD experience



What We Offer

- Opportunity to work on a real product used by mobile users

- Ownership over backend systems and API design

- Flexible, remote-friendly working environment

- Collaborative, product-focused team

- Room to grow as the platform and company scale

title: Operations & Customer Service Coordinator (Social Media)
description:
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:



Staff Scheduling & Coverage

*Manage daily and weekly staff schedules across multiple locations

*Monitor staff call-outs, tardiness, and availability changes

*Proactively secure shift coverage when employees call off

*Serve as the primary contact for staff schedule-related issues

*Maintain structured communication channels (e.g., GroupMe)



Client Communication & Issue Resolution

*Answer inbound calls and messages for all locations using provided systems

*Confidently handle client complaints and service issues

*Apply compensation policies consistently (no unauthorized refunds)

*De-escalate difficult client interactions calmly and professionally

*Document issues and resolutions for tracking and reporting

*Reach out to clients to update membership payment details (card on file no longer working)



Booking & System Support

*Assist with appointment booking and rescheduling

*Navigate booking platforms and internal systems

*Coordinate between locations to maximize coverage and service quality

*Learn and navigate booking and internal business systems to support scheduling, client management, and daily operations

*Run basic system reports (appointments, memberships, call activity, etc.) to support operational tracking and decision-making



Operational Structure & Reporting

*Inbox Management and Calendar Management

*Reach out to the tea
mbers to collect photos and videos of the clients

*Provide support in mobilizing tasks and ensuring tasks are getting completed

*Create and maintain basic operational tracking (missed calls, coverage issues, response times)

*Use spreadsheets (Excel or Google Sheets) to organize, track, and interpret operational data

*Flag recurring operational problems and recommend improvements

*Follow defined SOPs and help improve them over time

*Support onboarding and training of future operational hires



Growth Path (Important)

Within 60–90 days, this role is expected to:

*Take full ownership of daily scheduling

*Help train additional staff (phone support, scheduling)

*Act as the operational “hub” instead of the owner

*Contribute to building a scalable ops structure



Qualifications

*2+ years of experience in operations, scheduling, or team coordination

*At least 1 year of experience in customer service

*Social media management experience is required

*Strong phone confidence — able to handle difficult client conversations

*Comfortable enforcing policies without escalation to ownership

*Highly organized and calm under pressure

*Clear, professional English communication (spoken and written)

*Able to manage real-time disruptions independently

*Comfortable learning and using business software (booking platforms, reporting tools, spreadsheets); QuickBooks experience is a plus

*Experience supporting multi-location or service-based businesses is a strong plus



Tech & Setup Requirements

*Reliable computer (minimum i5 or equivalent with 8GB RAM)

*Stable internet connection (minimum 100 MBPS download speed)

*Must have a minimum of 50MBPS back up internet

*Comfortable using Time Doctor and standard remote collaboration tools



*Job Type: Full-time

*Schedule: 8AM - 5PM CST Monday to Friday // 10PM -7AM PHT Monday to Friday

*Salary Range: Php 40,000-60,000

title: Part-Time Social Media Manager / Content & Video Specialist
description:
Job Description: Social Media Manager / Content & Video Specialist



Role Overview

We are looking for a highly organized Social Media Manager to manage content planning, creation, scheduling, and publishing across multiple platforms. This role is execution-focused: once content is approved, you ensure it is scheduled, published, and never dropped. You will also handle basic video editing and content repurposing.



Platforms Managed

YouTube

 (Business & Personal Brand)

Instagram (Business & Personal Brand)

LinkedIn (Personal & Company Pages)

GoHighLevel Communities



Key Responsibilities

Content Planning & Scheduling

Create a monthly content calendar aligned with a single monthly theme

Separate planners for personal brand and business brand (when needed)

Submit full monthly plans for approval before publishing

Ensure ALL approved content is scheduled and published on time



Content Creation & Repurposing

Design social media graphics using Canva

Beautify provided copy while keeping messaging aligned

Repurpose long-form content (courses, trainings, YouTube videos) into:

Short-form clips

Quotes

Educational posts

Pull usable snippets from raw footage and edited videos

Video Editing

Crop and edit videos for social media use

Create short clips from YouTube, course content, and training videos

Basic video editing using tools like CapCut, Descript, or similar

Publishing & Execution

Schedule posts via GoHighLevel social planner

Cross-post content appropriately across platforms

Ensure important announcements (closures, events, reminders) are published

Content Organization

Manage content folders and assets (Google Drive, Canva, video files)

Build and maintain a content library for reuse

Label and organize B-roll, product images, and event footage

Event & Behind-the-Scenes Content

Create posts for events, speaking engagements, trainings, and launches

Use event photos and videos to create timely “behind-the-scenes” content



Required Skills & Experience

Proven experience as a Social Media Manager

Strong Canva and graphic design skills

Video editing knowledge (short-form and basic long-form)

Experience managing content calendars and scheduling tools

Ability to repurpose educational and long-form content

Extremely detail-oriented and execution-focused



Ideal Traits

Excellent follow-through (nothing gets missed)

Organized and deadline-driven

Creative but process-oriented

Comfortable working independently once direction is given



Rate: $6/hour

Schedule: Part-time, Remote PST

Requirement: Minimum 1 year of Proven experience as a Social Media Manager



Important:

*Only applicants who meet the requirements will be considered.

*Make sure your resume and portfolio are updated, as these will be the main basis for screening.

title: Short-Form Video Editor (CapCut + B-roll) for Instagram Reels
description:
Hi there,



I run a sports nutrition membership business in Australia working with combat sport athletes.



I film simple talking-head videos for Instagram Reels. I need a reliable editor to turn these into clean, engaging reels with captions and light b-roll.



This is simple, repeatable editing:



- Cuts with alternating scales

- Clean captions

- Relevant b-roll added to make the video more engaging



No fancy effects. No creative directing. Just clean, professional edits done consistently.



Work Required Each Week:



- Minimum 3 videos per week

- Each video 45–90 seconds

- I upload raw videos to Google Drive

- You edit and return within 48 hours



What I Need You To Do



For each video:



- Remove mistakes and pauses

- Add zoom cuts to keep it engaging

- Add clean captions (CapCut auto-captions are fine, just tidy them)

- Add simple, relevant b-roll where appropriate (training, fighting, gym, food, athletes, etc.)

- Export in 9:16 format ready for Instagram Reels



A collection of B-roll will be provided, but you must be able to effectively choose the most appropriate b-roll for the reel. Initially, You will edit just the talking head without B-roll.



Tools:

- CapCut

- Google Drive



You must already be comfortable using CapCut for reels and adding b-roll.



Pay:



- Paid per video

- Ongoing weekly work

- Long-term role if reliable

- Video's without B-roll will be paid at 300 PHP per video, while videos with B-roll will be paid at 400 PHP.



You are perfect for this if you:



- Have edited reels before using CapCut

- Know how to add b-roll tastefully (not over the top)

- Work fast and consistently

- Follow a style reference exactly

- Have good English for captions



To Apply (IMPORTANT)



Please do the following:



- Send 2 examples of reels you have edited with captions and b-roll

- Confirm you can deliver 3 videos per week within 48 hours

description:
MUST SEND A 60 SECOND LOOM WITH YOUR EXPERIENCE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR POSITION!

Location: Remote



Are you passionate about helping others achieve financial freedom and literacy? We are seeking a skilled Virtual Assistant to join our team and assist clients in disputing inaccurate credit reports and navigating the complex world of credit repair and financial literacy.

Benefits:

- Competitive compensation package.



If you have a passion for helping others and possess the skills and qualifications listed above, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and make a difference in the world of credit repair and financial literacy.



3 Commas Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or other protected status.

The ideal candidate can translate design concepts into accurate 2D drawings, detailed 3D models, and visually compelling renderings, delivering work independently with precision and accountability.

3D Modelling & Rendering:

title: Online Arbitrage Amazon & Walmart Sourcing Expert & Trainer
description:
Experience Level: Expert / Senior



About the Role: We are looking for a true Online Arbitrage (OA) veteran to not only source profitable products but to take a leading role in our business. You will be the "Head of Sourcing," responsible for finding high-ROI leads for Amazon and Walmart flip opportunities.



Crucially, this is a teaching position. You will be on camera, communicating directly with a Western audience and potentially training junior employees in the future. You must be comfortable explaining why a buy is good, not just finding it.



Who You Are:



You are an expert at reading Keepa charts. You don't just look at the price; you understand sales velocity, buy box suppression, and price stability over time.



You are a great communicator. Your English is clear, confident, and professional. You are happy to jump on Zoom/Google Meet calls to discuss strategy.



You are friendly and patient. You enjoy sharing your knowledge and helping others understand the sourcing process.



Your Responsibilities:

- Expert Sourcing: Find profitable OA leads across US retailers (Walmart, Target, etc.) to flip on Amazon & Walmart.

- Deep Analysis: Analyze Keepa, Sellify, and competitive data to ensure low risk and high reward and to be able to explain why you like a product

- Leadership & Training: Record Loom videos or host live calls breaking down your sourcing methods to teach our team/audience.

- Strategy: Identify new storefronts to stalk, new categories to gate-unlock, and new coupons/cashback opportunities.



Required Tools & Skills:

- Mastery of: Keepa 

- Sourcing Methods: Reverse Sourcing, Storefront Stalking, Manual Sourcing.

- Metrics: Understanding of BSR, ROI, Net Profit, and IP Complaints.

- Tech: High-speed internet, working webcam, and clear microphone (Non-negotiable).



Why Join Us?

- Leadership Opportunity: We don't want a robot; we want a partner who can lead the sourcing department.

- Growth: As we scale, your role (and compensation) can grow with us.

- Stability: Long-term position with a friendly, respectful team culture.



How to Apply (Read Carefully): To be considered, you must follow these steps. Applications that do not follow these instructions will be ignored.



1. Send a message with the subject line: "I am your OA Sourcing Lead"

2. Include a link to your resume/portfolio.

3. The Video Test: Please include a link to a short (1-3 minute) Loom video introducing yourself. In the video, please pull up a random product on Amazon and talk us through the Keepa chart and explain why it is (or isn't) a good buy. We need to hear your English and teaching style.

4. Tell us your favorite sourcing tool and why.



We are looking to hire immediately. Good luck!

title: Maintenance Coordinator
description:
US Eastern Standard Time (EST)

About the Role



We are a growing U.S.-based property management company seeking an experienced Service Coordinator / Virtual Assistant to manage property maintenance operations remotely. This role is critical to keeping our maintenance team organized, responsive, and efficient.



You will be the central point of coordination between tenants, technicians, vendors, and internal teams—ensuring service requests are documented accurately, scheduled properly, and resolved efficiently using Rent Manager.



Important: This role requires prior Rent Manager experience. Applications without Rent Manager experience will not be considered.



Critical Requirements (Must-Have)



Please apply only if you meet all of the following:



Rent Manager Experience (Required)

Hands-on experience using Rent Manager for service tickets, scheduling, billing, and documentation

US EST Availability

Must be available during US Eastern Standard Time, starting no later than 6:30 AM EST

Service Coordination Experience

Minimum 2 years in property maintenance coordination, service dispatch, or a similar role

Fluent English Communication

Excellent written and spoken English (direct communication with U.S. tenants, technicians, and vendors)



Key Responsibilities

1. Communication & Service Request Management

Monitor and manage incoming service requests via phone calls,
s, text messages, and online maintenance tickets

Encourage text-based communication with photos and detailed descriptions to improve diagnostic accuracy

Create accurate and detailed service tickets in Rent Manager, including proper category, priority level, and clear issue descriptions

Attach all related communications, photos, and notes to each ticket



2. Scheduling & Technician Dispatch

Daily Technician Briefing (6:30 AM EST):

Prepare and send a daily issue list to each technician

Include issue numbers and brief subject summaries

Send booking links to tenants for non-emergency service requests

Handle emergency dispatch by contacting on-call technicians directly via phone

Coordinate schedules to maximize technician efficiency and minimize downtime



3. Parts Ordering & Inventory Tracking

Order parts and supplies from approved vendors (e.g., Home Depot, Lowe’s)

Use proper purchase orders when applicable

Upload all receipts and confirmations to the corresponding Rent Manager tickets

Coordinate with technicians to track inventory usage and update inventory records

Monitor stock levels and initiate reorders as needed



4. Service Coordination & Resolution

Manage schedules for reactive maintenance, preventive maintenance, and capital improvement projects

Maintain consistent communication with technicians until issue completion

Notify tenants via text once work is completed

Send customer satisfaction survey links to collect feedback



5. Billing & Payroll Support

Review daily technician hours for accuracy

Match logged hours with clock-in times and billable entries in Rent Manager

Support accurate billing and payroll workflows



6. Asset Maintenance & Unit Turnovers

title: Non-Voice Qualifying Analyst
description:
PLEASE APPLY THROUGH THIS LINK:


/applyjob-noncaller-1



About Us:

With over 100 years of combined industry experience, the Community Minerals team specializes in the purchase of mineral or royalty rights all over the US. We have earned a stellar reputation with hundreds of satisfied customers and an “A” Rating with the Better Business Bureau. With our proven track record, we continue to serve mineral owners in several states with transparency, accountability, and a personalized experience to meet individual needs.



Job Summary:

To support the acquisition of mineral rights by accurately qualifying leads and property information through non-voice channels such as
 and SMS tools. This role is responsible for assessing property ownership, verifying data against acquisition criteria, and ensuring only qualified opportunities are forwarded to the sales or acquisitions team. The analyst plays a key role in streamlining the purchase pipeline while maintaining data accuracy and operational efficiency.



Job Description:

-Engage mineral owners through professional and persuasive written communication via
 and SMS.

-Identify seller motivation and timeline through thoughtful and strategic questioning.

-Request and collect key documents (e.g., royalty statements, payout details) to support underwriting.

-Input accurate and thorough lead notes into the CRM to support the sales pipeline.

-Provide feedback to improve marketing strategies and outreach effectiveness.

-Collaborate with internal teams to ensure qualified leads meet underwriting and acquisition criteria.

-Maintain follow-up sequences and track engagement to ensure timely and consistent communication.

-Conduct follow-up calls with leads as needed to ensure timely communication and support.



Professional Experience:

Minimum of 2 years in lead generation,
 marketing, or sales operations.

Experience in mineral rights, real estate, or investment industries is a plus.

Sales or customer service experience is highly preferred.



Communication Skills:

Demonstrates excellent written communication, with the ability to convey professionalism, clarity, and empathy through
, SMS, and CRM notes.

Able to adapt tone and messaging to suit different types of leads, ensuring clear understanding and a positive brand impression.

Proactively asks the right questions and gathers key details through non-verbal exchanges, maintaining accuracy and 
ntum throughout the qualification process.

Provides clear, concise updates and documentation to internal teams, supporting seamless collaboration and efficient decision-making.





Analytical and Problem-Solving Aptitude:

Skilled in reviewing and interpreting property data, ownership records, and lead information to determine alignment with acquisition criteria.

Applies sound judgment when identifying incomplete, conflicting, or unclear details, and takes initiative to resolve issues or escalate when needed.

Continuously evaluates patterns and trends in lead quality, contributing valuable insights to improve targeting and qualification strategies.





Attention to Precision:

Maintains a high level of accuracy when reviewing and entering lead and property data, ensuring all details are complete, consistent, and aligned with acquisition standards.

Approaches every task with careful attention to detail, recognizing that even small discrepancies can affect the success of the acquisition process.





Technical Proficiency:

Able to quickly learn and adapt to new software, workflows, and digital communication tools to support efficient and accurate lead qualification.



Efficient Management Skills:

Demonstrates strong organizational skills by efficiently managing lead flow, prioritizing tasks, and maintaining accurate, timely records to support seamless acquisition processes.



Continuous Performance Enhancement:

Continuously seeks opportunities to improve workflows, enhance lead qualification accuracy, and contribute to team performance through proactive learning and feedback.



Commitment to Professionalism:

Upholds a high standard of professionalism by consistently delivering quality work, maintaining confidentiality, and representing the company with integrity in all communications.



Other Requirements:

Must be willing to work during US business hours



What's in it for You:

- Competitive Compensation: Earn $3.55 - $3.99 per hour, commensurate with your skills and experience.

- Work your way: Remote Work Set-Up enabling you to operate from the comfort and convenience of your own chosen workspace

- Health and Happiness: Comprehensive Health, Dental, and Life Insurance for you and your dependents (Philippines)

- Wellness Perks: Health and Wellness Perks to help maintain a healthy work-life balance (Philippines)

- Success Incentives: Enjoy company bonuses and performance-driven rewards.

- Soar with Us: Opportunities for career growth and promotions await you.

- Positive Vibes Only: Experience a supportive and uplifting work culture.

- Annual Bonus: We value your dedication throughout the year, rewarding you with an annual performance bonus shared at the end of the year.

- Performance Raise: Your hard work doesn't go unnoticed. Be ready to seize opportunities for a salary increase based on your outstanding performance.

- Performance Incentives: We believe exceptional work deserves recognition. Performance incentives are awarded to individuals who demonstrate outstanding contributions, initiative, and results. It’s our way of celebrating excellence and motivating continued success.

- Discretionary Bonus: At Community Minerals, exceptional work doesn’t go unnoticed. Contractors who consistently go above and beyond may be rewarded with discretionary bonuses, a token of appreciation for outstanding contributions, impactful results, and dedication to excellence. Let your work speak, and the rewards will follow!



Other Requirements:

- Willing to work in US Business Hours (CST)

- Must have stable Internet and Power Connection

- Must have a Computer with at least 2 monitors set up, a stable Internet Connection



System Requirements:

To ensure optimal performance and functionality while using different web and application tools, please make sure that your syste
ets the following requirements:



Operating System:

- Windows: Windows 10 (64-bit) or higher

- macOS: macOS 11 (Big Sur) or higher



Processor:

- Intel: 8th Gen Core i3, i5, i7, or newer

- AMD: Ryzen 3 (2018) or newer



Memory (RAM):

- A minimum of 8 GB of RAM is required.

- Recommended: 16 GB RAM for multitasking and optimal performance

title: Google Business Profile Expert
description:
(Please read application procedure below)



Job Description:



We are looking for a skilled Google Business Profile (GBP) Expert to manage and optimize GBP listings for our clients/business. The ideal candidate has experience in local SEO (geo-targeting), understands GBP best practices, and can implement strategies to enhance online visibility and engagement.





Key Responsibilities:



GBP Optimization: Create, claim, verify, and manage GBP listings, ensuring all business information is accurate, complete, and up to date.

Local SEO Strategy: Implement local SEO strategies to improve rankings in local search results and Google Maps.

Review Management: Monitor and respond to customer reviews professionally, improving reputation and engagement.

Performance Tracking: Analyze GBP insights, track performance metrics, and provide data-driven recommendations for improvement.

Content Updates: Post updates, promotions, events, and photos to increase engagement and visibility.

Troubleshooting & Compliance: Address GBP issues such as suspensions, incorrect listings, and duplicate entries while ensuring compliance with Google’s guidelines.

Competitor Analysis: Conduct competitive research to identify opportunities for improvement and growth.

Collaboration: Work with marketing, SEO, and customer service teams to align GBP strategies with broader business goals.





Requirements:

Experience: 2+ years of hands-on experience managing and optimizing Google Business Profiles.

SEO Knowledge: Strong understanding of local SEO, Google’s ranking factors, and best practices.

Analytical Skills: Proficiency in analyzing GBP insights, Google Analytics, and SEO tools.

Technical Skills: Ability to troubleshoot GBP issues, manage listings at scale, and handle verification processes.

Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills for engaging with customers via reviews and posts.

Attention to Detail: Ability to ensure data accuracy and compliance with Google’s policies.





Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with GBP management tools (e.g., BrightLocal, Whitespark, Yext).

Familiarity with Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager, and other SEO tools.

Previous experience working with multi-location businesses or agencies.



Benefits:

Competitive salary

Flexible work environment 

Professional development opportunities



If you are passionate about local SEO and optimizing Google Business Profiles to drive business success, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now!



How to apply:



Send the following:



1) Resume/Portfolio

2) Please send in samples/proofs of your GBP previous works. (can be screenshots, links, etc)

3) Answer "List three Google tools you would use to analyze and improve a GBP listing."

title: Fiction Ghostwriter – Adaptive Modern Rewrite of Public Domain Novel (Audio-First)
description:
Overview

I’m looking for a fiction ghostwriter to adapt classic public-domain novels into present-day stories written in clear, modern, spoken English for adult ESL learners.

This is adaptive modernization, not light editing.

You will:

    • keep the core plot and themes

    • move the story into a modern (2020s) setting

    • rewrite the language for audio narration and immersion

The first project will be an adaptive rewrite of The Time Machine (H.G. Wells) set in the modern world.



What You’ll Be Doing

    • Adapt public-domain fiction into a current-day setting

    • Preserve the story arc, ideas, and tension

    • Rewrite language so it sounds natural when spoken

    • Write chapter-based episodes (?1,500–2,300 words each)

    • Deliver consistent weekly output

This is not summarizing, paraphrasing, or lightly editing old text.

This is a full narrative rewrite using the original story as the foundation.



Modernization Guidelines (Important)

    • The story takes place in the present or near-present

    • Outdated settings, social norms, and references are updated

    • Characters think and speak like modern people

    • Themes remain intact (no fan-fiction or moral lectures)

Think:

“If this story were written today for modern listeners.”



Output Expectations

    • Target: ~15,000 words per week

    • Equivalent to 7–10 chapters

    • Publishing cadence: 5 chapters per week

I care about weekly output, not daily hours.

Work when it fits your life — mornings, evenings, weekends, etc.



What I Care About

    • Clear storytelling

    • Consistent tone

    • Meeting weekly output targets

    • Ability to follow constraints

    • Writing that flows naturally when read aloud



What I Don’t Care About

    • When you work

    • Where you work

    • Fancy credentials

    • Marketing or SEO experience

    • Over-explaining your process



Required Experience

You must have at least one of the following:

    • Long-form fiction writing (novels, serialized fiction, web novels)

    • Fiction ghostwriting

    • Scriptwriting or narrative storytelling

If your experience is mostly blogs, SEO, or sales copy, this role is not a good fit.



Nice to Have (Not Required)

    • Experience adapting or rewriting existing stories

    • Experience writing for audio or narration

    • Familiarity with ESL readers/listeners



Compensation

    • Hourly or weekly rate (to be discussed)

    • Approx. 20 hours per week

    • Long-term work available for the right fit

This is ongoing, not a one-off project.



1 hour Paid Trial Task

Shortlisted applicants will complete a paid trial:

    • Rewrite a short scene (800–1,200 words)

    • Set in the modern world

    • Audio-first language

    • No outlines or explanations — just the writing



How to Apply

Please include:

    1. A short note about your fiction writing experience

    2. 1–2 fiction samples (not blogs)

    3. Confirmation that you’re comfortable with weekly output targets

Generic cover letters will be ignored.



Final Note

This role is for writers who:

    • like structure

    • write consistently

    • don’t need micromanagement

    • want stable, long-term work

If that sounds like you, apply.

• YouTube reaction faces and clickbait thumbnails

• Fast jump cuts meant for TikTok retention

• UGC/commercial ad style editing



That is NOT the aesthetic I want.



---



### ???? WHAT I AM LOOKING FOR

I need an editor who can create:



• Online course modules

• Coaching lessons

• masterclass-style videos

• calm educational content

• cinematic but simple storytelling

• luxury, minimal, professional pacing



Think:

? digital classroom

? mentorship conversation

? cozy learning environment

? elevated tutorial experience



NOT influencer content.

NOT podcast bro content.

NOT viral gimmicks.



---



### REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

You must have experience with at least ONE of these:

• Editing online courses or e-learning modules

• Educational long-form content

• Documentary-style storytelling

• Brand-first cinematic editing

• Coaching or masterclass video production



I will ONLY review applicants who submit:



???? Long-form examples (5–15 minutes minimum)

???? Course / educational style work

???? Clean, minimalist edits



**Do NOT send reels, TikToks, or short clips as your main portfolio.**



---



### EDITING STYLE I WANT

• Calm pacing

• Elegant typography

• Subtle transitions

• Clean B-roll integration

• On-screen text used sparingly

• No cartoon energy

• No aggressive sound effects

• Focus on learning & clarity



The edit should feel like:



“Sit with me and learn”

not

“Scroll and be entertained.”



---



### WHAT YOU WILL EDIT

• Course modules for hairstylists

• Coaching lessons

• talking-head educational videos

• screen recordings + demonstrations

• lifestyle learning visuals



Length per video:

10–30 minutes average



---



### TECHNICAL SKILLS

You must be comfortable with:

• Color grading

• Audio cleanup

• Smooth pacing

• Minimalist motion graphics

• Professional subtitles (optional, not karaoke)

• Organized file delivery



---



### HOW TO APPLY

In your application, send:

1. ONLY long-form examples (5–15+ minutes)

2. Tell me if you’ve edited courses before

3. Describe your editing approach for LEARNING content

4. Your rate per:

   • 10-minute video

   • 20-minute video

   • 30-minute video

5. Turnaround time



If you send TikTok/reels only, I will not respond.



---



### TEST PROJECT



I will provide:

• a 10-minute raw lesson clip



You will create:

• one sample edit in the style described



Paid test for qualified candidates only.



---



I’m building long-term educational content for my brand.

I need an editor who understands **mood, learning, and luxury not trends.**



If that’s you, I’d love to work together.
