title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: SEO Content Strategist & Writer (Home Services Only, Remote)
description:
**About Genesis SEO**



We help home services and construction companies win local markets with practical SEO, clean Webflow websites, and content that drives real leads. We only work with home services. No lawyers, no random industries.



### The Role



This is a strategist + senior writer role. You will build a **Keyword Domination Plan** for each client, then execute it through content and on-page SEO. The goal is to help clients start ranking faster for their core services, then expand into supporting topics that build authority.



### What You’ll Do



**1) Strategy (Domination Plans)**



- Do keyword research using **SEMrush, Keyword Planner, and Surfer SEO**

- Build a clear Domination Plan (what pages/topics ship first, second, third)

- Turn it into weekly deliverables and keep it visible in **ClickUp**



**2) Writing (E-E-A-T + conversion-focused)**



- Write/optimize service pages, supporting pages, city pages, landing pages, blogs, and occasional case studies

- Write content that’s accurate, useful, and built to convert real customers

- Structure content to perform in Google and be readable/usable for AI platforms



**3) On-page SEO (practical)**



- Titles, metas, H1/H2 structure, intent match, and conversion updates

- Internal linking plans + help prevent/fix cannibalization

- Communicate basic schema needs to dev (AI generates schema, you just specify what’s needed)



**4) Collaboration + Publishing**



- Coordinate with our Webflow developer (copy aligned to wireframes/UX)

- QA pages before publish (formatting, links, on-page checklist)

- Document work clearly in ClickUp

- Support quarterly/semi-annual reporting inputs tied to what shipped



### Our Tool Stack (fixed)



- **Webflow** (all sites)

- **ClickUp** (only PM tool)

- **SEMrush, Google Keyword Planner, Surfer SEO**

- **ChatGPT** (to speed up work, not replace thinking)



No Screaming Frog, regex/server logs, backlinking, or outreach in this role.



---



### Detail Check (Required)



To be considered, start your application message with:



**“SEO Content Writer 49 from, [Your Name]”**



---



### Must-Haves



- Proven experience building keyword-based content plans and executing them

- Strong SEO writing for service pages + long-form content (clear, helpful, conversion-minded)

- Solid on-page fundamentals (titles, metas, headings, internal links, avoiding cannibalization)

- Comfortable collaborating with a developer in Webflow workflows

- Organized and consistent with documentation in ClickUp

- Professional communication; camera on during 1:1 and team calls



### Nice-to-Haves (Not Required)



- Topical maps / content architecture experience for local service businesses

- Strong brand voice and copywriting range across multiple clients

- Interest in helping build future content automation systems (planned within 6 months)



### Pay, Incentives, and Growth



- **Base pay (Phase 1, first 3 months): $900**

- **Bonuses + incentive program:** tied to client milestones based on quarterly/semi-annual reporting (depends on client plan)

- **Pay scaling:** increases after Phase 1 based on performance

- **Year-end bonuses:** available for top performers

- **Leadership track:** lead roles available within **6–12 months** for strong performers



### Working Hours (Long-Term Only)



- Monday–Friday, **8 hours/day**

- Core availability: **7:00 AM – 3:00 PM (your local time)**

- Respond within **2 hours** during working hours

- Acknowledge task comments the same day

- If you’ll be delayed, proactively explain it

title: Account Coordinator & GHL Automation Specialist
description:
**About Genesis SEO**

We help construction and home services companies win local markets with practical SEO, clean websites, and content that builds real authority. We move fast, keep communication professional, and measure outcomes.



## The Role



You will be the bridge between our technical systems and our clients' success. You will own the client onboarding process after their website is built, ensuring they are fully trained and integrated into our GoHighLevel (GHL) ecosystem. Your goal is to build relationships with clients while designing and maintaining the automation engines that drive their business—from review requests and database reactivation to "voi
 bombs" and unified communication pipelines.



The whole team is expected to work: Working Hours: 4PM PST to 11:30 PM PST. With 30 min of lunch in between and be availle 



## What You’ll Do



### Client Onboarding & Account Management



Lead the Handoff: Take ownership of the client relationship immediately after the website build is complete.



Training & Support: Conduct front-end and back-end training sessions, teaching clients and their teams how to use their new systems (CRM, pipelines, and reporting).



Ongoing Communication: Host weekly or monthly performance meetings to review work completed, discuss metrics, and coordinate next steps.



Team Liaison: Act as the central point of contact, communicating client needs clearly to the rest of our professional team to ensure nothing falls through the cracks.



### GHL Automation & System Architecture



Unified Communications: Set up and maintain a centralized inbox that merges Yelp, website widgets, SMS, and
 into one platform.



Automated Outreach: Build and manage workflows for automated review requests, referral generation, and repeat appointment reminders.



Database Reactivation: Execute "voi
 bombs" and text/email blasts to send targeted mass communications to leads and customer lists.



Phone Systems: Configure VoIP systems for clients, ensuring call tracking, recording, and metrics are functioning correctly.



### Marketing Campaigns & Reporting



Lifecycle Marketing: Create and manage
 campaigns tailored to specific stages of the sales funnel, including seasonal blasts and monthly newsletters.



Chat Widgets: Install and configure website chat widgets for real-time lead capture.



Reporting: Design customized dashboards inside GHL that provide clients with clear visibility into their ROI and KPIs.



Social & Content: Assist with social media planning for repeat content and ensure consistent messaging across all channels.



### What Success Looks Like (Accountability)



Smooth Onboarding: Clients feel confident and supported during the transition from "build" to "live."



System Uptime: Automations trigger correctly, and communication channels (VoIP, Chat, SMS) remain active without error.



Client Retention: Clients see the value of the software through your regular reporting meetings and proactive support.



Documentation: All workflows, client interaction notes, and task statuses are documented clearly in ClickUp.



When you apply, write the title of your job post as “GHL Automation Specialist 49 from” and then add your name to be considered.



Response Time: Client inquiries regarding their accounts or software are addressed promptly and professionally.



### Your Authority



Make decisions on the best automation logic for specific client needs.



Propose new GHL features or workflows that could benefit our client base.



Manage the client meeting schedule and set the agenda for performance reviews.



**Must-Haves (Skills and Tools)**



- **Expert-Level GoHighLevel (GHL):** Deep understanding of snapshots, workflows, pipelines, triggers, and smart lists.

- **VoIP & Telephony Experience:** Ability to set up Twilio/LeadConnector phone numbers, call forwarding, and voi
 drops.

- **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written English; comfortable leading Zoom calls with business owners and training non-technical staff.

- *
 Marketing:** Experience writing and designing newsletters and drip campaigns that convert.

- **Project Management:** Organized in ClickUp or similar PM tools; you document your process and decisions.

- **Professional Presence:** Positive, proactive, and solution-focused; camera on during 1:1 and team calls.



**Nice-to-Haves**



- Experience with N8N or Zapier for integrations outside of GHL.

- Basic understanding of SEO and how it feeds into the CRM pipelines.

- Experience with social media scheduling tools.

- HTML/CSS knowledge for
 template customization.



### Working Hours (Long-Term Only)



- Monday–Friday, **8 hours/day**

- Core availability: **7:00 AM – 3:00 PM (your local time)**

- Respond within **2 hours** during working hours

- Acknowledge task comments the same day

- If you’ll be delayed, proactively explain it

title: Remote Structural Engineer / Revit Modeler
description:
******TO BE CONSIDERED AS AN APPLICANT, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR MOST UP-TO-DATE RESUME AND A VIDEO INTRODUCTION TAILORED TO THIS JOB POSTING!******



Job Type: Full-Time

Work Hours: Sunday to Thursday, 2:00 PM-10:30 PM PST (30-minute unpaid break) - Subject to client requirements

Salary: $1,200 per month



Job Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled Structural Engineer / Revit Modeler to join our team. This role focuses on designing and detailing multi-level storage buildings, which require a unique structural approach due to their heavy load-bearing systems and specialized construction methods.

The ideal candidate is not only a strong structural engineer but also a super expert in Revit modeling, capable of creating precise, complex models with minimal supervision.



Key Responsibilities:

Design and model heavy, multi-level storage buildings using Revit.

Perform structural analysis and detailing specific to high-load industrial and storage facilities.

Develop accurate construction documents and shop drawings.

Collaborate with the engineering and design team to ensure models meet structural and architectural requirements.

Identify and solve design challenges with a focus on constructability and safety.

Maintain accuracy and consistency across all Revit models and related documentation.

Coordinate with project managers and other disciplines to ensure seamless project delivery.



Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Structural Engineering, Civil Engineering, or related field.

Industrial and commercial engineering experience preferred, particularly with heavy load-bearing structures.

Proven expertise as a Revit Modeler, with advanced knowledge of large-scale modeling.

Strong understanding of structural systems, especially for multi-level and heavy storage buildings.

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and collaboration abilities in a remote team environment.



Preferred Skills:

Experience with Steel Structures, Concrete Structures, Masonry Construction, Light and Gauge Steel Structures

Familiarity with BIM coordination and clash detection.

Knowledge of U.S. building codes and standards is a plus.

Knowledge of ETABS and SAFE is a plus.



Note: An NBI or police clearance will be required upon acceptance of the job offer.

title: General VA – E-commerce & Business Operations
description:
Are you an experienced VA who thrives in fast-paced e-commerce environments?



We’re looking for a proactive, detail-oriented, and resourceful VA to help us keep our Shopify stores running smoothly and efficiently. This role goes beyond basic admin tasks, you’ll be directly supporting operations, improving workflows, and contributing to the long-term growth of our business.



If you’re motivated, independent, and passionate about e-commerce, we’d love to hear from you.



-- Key Responsibilities



You’ll be working closely with our team to:



Support Shopify store management (updates, product listings, troubleshooting).



Oversee order processing and fulfillment coordination.



Assist with customer support communication (using Gorgias/Zendesk or similar).



Manage and update backend apps/integrations.



Create and maintain SOPs, reports, and task trackers.



Conduct research and administrative tasks to support business growth.



Help coordinate marketing activities 
s, promos, social content scheduling).



-- Required Skills & Qualifications



We’re looking for someone who is:



Experienced with Shopify (minimum 1 year of hands-on work).



Familiar with customer service tools (Gorgias/Zendesk or similar).



Skilled in organization, time management, and communication.



Proactive, problem-solving, and able to work with minimal supervision.



Comfortable with tools like Slack, Trello, Google Workspace.



Bonus: Experience with Klaviyo/email marketing or team coordination.



-- What We Offer



A long-term, stable role with growth opportunities.



The chance to work with a supportive, international team.



Career progression, potential to take on more responsibility in operations or management.



A role where your ideas and contributions are valued.



-- Who This Role is Perfect For



This is for you if:



You’ve worked as a VA, e-commerce assistant, or store manager and want to level up your career.



You enjoy solving problems, improving processes, and learning new skills.



You’re serious about growing with a company long-term, not just freelancing short-term gigs.



-- How to Apply



1. Create a brief Loom video for me going over the following:

- A short introduction about yourself and your e-commerce work experience.

- Examples of Shopify stores, projects, or tasks you’ve managed.

- What makes you a good candidate for this job?

- What is your current work availability, and do you have any commitments that may affect your working full-time? Can you work Saturdays and Sundays?

- Hobbies and interests: What you enjoy doing outside of work.

- Fun fact: Interesting or unique personal fact.



Upload the video to 
 and send me the link. And don't forget to say 'Pumpkin Seeds' at the end of the video!



2. Attach your CV/Resume in PDF format. 



3. Provide your WhatsApp number and Linkedin (optional)



4. Use this subject line format: GVA – [Your Name] – [Favorite Color]



NOTE: Applications that don’t follow this format will not be considered.



We’re excited to meet the right person who will grow with us and help move our business forward!

title: Accounts Reconciliation Specialist
description:
We are seeking a highly detail-oriented and reliable Accounts Reconciliation Specialist who is comfortable leveraging AI tools and smart workflows to produce accurate, well-structured financial reconciliation outcomes.



This role focuses on monthly credit card reconciliation, with responsibility for analysing, categorising, and clearly separating personal vs. business expenses, and delivering concise reconciliation reports twice a month (mid-month and end-of-month).



This is an ongoing, ad-hoc role suited to someone who values precision, clarity, and efficient execution — and knows how to use AI to work smarter without compromising accuracy.



Key Responsibilities



Analyse credit card statements and transaction data using structured, repeatable workflows



Categorise transactions into clearly defined spending categories (e.g. business, personal, reimbursable, non-claimable)



Accurately split and track personal vs. business expenses



Prepare and deliver clear reconciliation reports:



Mid-month snapshot



End-of-month final reconciliation



Identify discrepancies, inconsistencies, or misclassified transactions and flag them clearly



Provide practical recommendations for corrections, reimbursements, or adjustments



Advise on required transfers or repayments between personal and business accounts



Use AI tools (e.g. for pattern recognition, categorisation assistance, anomaly detection, or report structuring) to improve speed, consistency, and accuracy — while maintaining human oversight and accountability



Requirements



Proven experience in accounts reconciliation, bookkeeping, or a similar finance-related role



Strong attention to detail and high standards for accuracy



Comfortable working with credit card statements and transactional financial data



Able to work independently, manage deadlines, and deliver clean outputs consistently



Proficient with spreadsheets and/or accounting software



Demonstrated ability to leverage AI tools responsibly to support financial analysis, categorisation, or reporting



Solid understanding of business vs. personal expense tracking



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field is a plus, but not mandatory if experience is strong



Compensation & Working Arrangement



Hourly rate, commensurate with experience



Flexible working hours



Deliverables required twice monthly (mid-month and end-of-month)



If you’re someone who combines financial discipline with modern AI-enabled workflows, and you take pride in producing clean, reliable reconciliations, we’d love to hear from you.



Apply here:

???? 



Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview and further discussion.

title: Full-Time Ecommerce Video Editor (with Growth Potential)
description:
We are a fast-growing 7-figure ecommerce brand seeking a top-tier Full-Time Video Editor to join our creative team. This role is perfect for someone who doesn’t just “edit videos,” but knows how to craft engaging, scroll-stopping content that converts.



If you’re looking for a role where you can grow into full-time, earn bonuses, and have a long-term seat on a winning team — keep reading.



Responsibilities:



- Edit high-performing ads and creatives tailored for ecommerce 
, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, etc.).



- Add sound effects, transitions, captions, and engagement-inducing elements to motion graphics and animations to maximize viewer retention.



- Source and repurpose raw content from platforms like TikTok, YouTube, Vimeo, and across the internet — not just stock libraries.



- Constantly search through ad libraries and tools like Atria to spot winning formats and bring fresh concepts to the team for testing.



- Incorporate motion graphics, text overlays, and light animation work to enhance storytelling.



- Analyze why certain ads work (or don’t) and apply learnings to improve iterations and future creatives.



- Collaborate with the marketing team to test, iterate, and improve creative performance.



- Stay up to date with trends in direct-to-consumer (DTC) and social-first content styles. Must be prepared to bring ideas to the table in terms of ad formats that resonate organically on target audiences feed, discovered thru ad libraries, and tools like atria/foreplay



- Deliver clean, polished, professional work that drives results.



Requirements:



- 3–5 years of video editing experience in ecommerce/DTC content (portfolio required).



- Advanced proficiency in major editing tools, including:



Adobe Premiere Pro



Final Cut Pro



CapCut



After Effects



DaVinci Resolve



(or other top industry tools)



- Skilled in motion graphics and animation.



- Proven ability to find and source unique video clips and raw content across the internet.



- Must have a strong foundation with AI tools to generate supporting imagery/b-roll/hooks as needed on platforms such as Google Veo3, NanoBanana, Higgsfield AI, GPT-5, Kling, Sora, etc.



- 100% fluent in English (a call with the founder will assess grammar and fluency; accents are fine).



- Strong sense of storytelling, pacing, and structure.



- Excellent communication, responsiveness, and a true team player.



- Bonus: Copywriting experience or comfort editing scripts/voiceover copy.



What We’re Looking For:



We are not looking for someone who just wants a paycheck. In the age of AI and quick shortcuts, it’s easy to see when someone cuts corners. We want someone who takes pride in their craft, who is ambitious, and who wants to help us win at a high level.



This part-time role has the potential to transition into full-time with increased pay, bonuses, and long-term growth opportunities for the right candidate.



How to Apply:



If this sounds like you, apply with:



- Your portfolio of e-commerce video work (ads, social content, product edits).



- A brief explanation of why you’re the right fit.



- Include the phrase “Long-Term Player” at the top of your application so we know you read this entire post.



Note: A paid trial task will be required for consideration for this role.

title: Meta Ads Creative Strategist: eCommerce Research & Ad Briefs (Video + Graphics)
description:
How To Apply: Please Fill Out Google Form

----------



About Comfort 365

Comfort 365 is a fast-growing insole & foot care brand within a leading shoe accessories company. Our mission is to elevate the footwear experience and make the very best foot care available to everyone.



Job Description

We’re looking for a Creative Strategist to help us develop and scale high-performing ad creatives for Meta Ads.

This role is not for someone who only writes copy or designs ads. You’ll be responsible for shaping the ideas behind the ads — identifying winning angles, translating customer desire into messaging, and guiding creative execution based on performance.



What You’ll Be Doing

- Developing creative angles based on customer desire, awareness, and market sophistication

- Writing clear, actionable creative briefs for video and static ads (hooks, angles, messaging, visual direction)

- Reviewing ad performance and identifying patterns in winning creatives

- Iterating and expanding winning concepts into scalable creative systems

- Collaborating with a creative team to align creatives with campaign goals



What We’re Looking For

- Experience working on paid ad creatives for eCommerce brands

- Strong understanding of desire, and customer psychology (applied, not theoretical)

- Ability to explain why an ad works and how to improve it

- Comfortable working in a performance-driven environment where results matter

- Clear communicator who can collaborate with a team

- Ability to use innovative tools and AI in the creative process



Nice to Have

- 2+ Years experience with Meta ads

- Familiarity with classic copywriting and marketing principles (and real-world application)

- Experience producing or guiding multiple winning ad concepts

- Previous work with an agency or eCommerce brand

- Fluent in English

title: Customer Experience & Operations Associate (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote | Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: Experienced Credit Repair Disputer
description:
Credit Repair Dispute Specialist (Full-Time)



Company: Lyle Consulting LLC

Position Type: Full-Time

Hours: 40 hours per week (8 hours per day M-F) (30min Break and a 15min break included)

THIS IS A LONG TERM POSITION PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOUR NOT LOOKING FOR LONG TERM STABILITY



You will not be working alone. You will be part of an established team with clear SOPs, structure, and real growth opportunities.



Responsibilities

---------------------------

As a Credit Repair Dispute Specialist, you will manage disputes from start to finish, including:



Online Bureau Disputes



Submitting disputes directly through:















Communicating with credit bureau customer service when needed



Working with client-provided logins and security codes to submit disputes inside online portals



Complaint & Report Management



Filing and managing:



CFPB complaints



BBB complaints



FTC identity theft reports



Uploading and managing supporting documentation through online portals



Handling LexisNexis disputes



Daily Workflow



Following company SOPs precisely



Maintaining accuracy, compliance, and organization



Completing a minimum of 7 to 8 dispute cases per day





ALL Requirements

-----------------------------------------------------------------



Proven experience in credit repair disputing



Mandatory experience with online bureau portals



Experience filing CFPB, BBB, FTC, and LexisNexis disputes



Very fluent English, written and spoken



Strong attention to detail and organization



Reliable internet connection



Ability to work independently and meet daily production goals



Strong work ethic and accountability



Team-oriented mindset



Strongly Preferred (May Affect Hiring Decision)



Experience using DisputeFox



Experience using GoHighLevel



Applicants without DisputeFox or GoHighLevel experience may not be considered.





What We Offer

--------------------------------------------------

Free training with full SOPs provided



Long-term job security



Supportive, team-based work environment



Performance incentives and growth opportunities



Company incentives such as bonuses and potential company getaways



Opportunity to grow into higher-responsibility and leadership roles



You are treated as a long-term partner, not just an employee





How to Apply (Very Important)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

To be considered, all applicants must submit the following:



A detailed written explanation of why you are a strong fit for this role



Short or generic applications will not be considered



Your portfolio or examples of past credit repair results, if available



A Loom video or short introduction video explaining:



Your experience with credit repair



Your experience with online bureau disputes



Why you are seeking a long-term role



Submitting a video significantly increases your chances of being hired!!!!

description:
How to Apply

$8-10/hour + Performance Incentives

About Us



We are Gushwork.ai — one of the fastest-growing AI marketing startups backed by global investors like Lightspeed, B Capital, and SIG. We help B2B manufacturing companies in the U.S. grow their online presence through AI-powered websites and SEO.



---

About the Role



We're hiring smart, energetic, and articulate Cold Callers / SDRs who can book appointments with decision-makers (owners, sales heads, marketing leads) of U.S. manufacturing companies.



Your mission? Spark meaningful conversations, qualify interest, and schedule discovery calls with our Account Executives.

* Make
outbound calls daily to U.S.-based B2B leads

title: Sales Closer
description:
How to Apply

* Send your most updated resume to 



About us:



Gushwork.ai builds AI Agents that help small and medium businesses automate their entire inbound marketing stack — from SEO and website content to reviews, blogs, and lead funnels. Our current focus is the manufacturing and industrial distributors industry.



In plain English: we’re replacing bloated marketing agencies with intelligent, always-on software.



Backed by Lightspeed, SIG, Beenext, and B Capital, Gushwork.ai is one of the fastest-growing AI companies globally.



In just a year, we’ve grown to $1.5M ARR and are scaling fast toward $15M ARR in the next 12 months — helping thousands of small businesses grow smarter, not harder.



The Role:



We’re looking for a closer who thrives in fast-paced, high-velocity sales environments. You’ll own the full sales cycle from discovery to close for qualified meetings booked by our 10-person BDR team. This is a quota-carrying role where you’ll close 4-8 deals monthly, with deal cycles ranging from 1-3 calls.



Working Hours: US Shift (9:00 AM - 6:00 PM EST)

Work Mode: Remote



What You’ll Do:



- Run discovery calls with qualified prospects (OEMs, distributors, manufacturers) to uncover pain points around lead generation and digital presence

- Deliver compelling demos that connect our AI SEO solution to specific business outcomes and revenue impact

- Navigate buying committees within SMB organizations, typically engaging with Marketing Directors, Sales Leaders, and C-suite

- Close deals on 12-month contracts with ACV of $5k-$25k, meeting or exceeding monthly quota

- Manage pipeline with discipline—forecast accurately, maintain detailed CRM hygiene, and move deals forward with urgency

- Partner with Growth Managers post-sale to ensure smooth handoffs and identify expansion opportunities

- Iterate on sales methodology by sharing wins/losses and collaborating on improving conversion rates



What Success Looks Like:



- Month 1-2: Ramp on product, market, and sales process; close your first 2-3 deals

- Month 3+: Consistently hit/exceed quota of 4-8 closed deals monthly

- Ongoing: Maintain 30%+ demo-to-close conversion rate and sub-30 day sales cycles



You’re a Great Fit If You Have:



- 2-4 years of closing experience in B2B SaaS, MarTech, or digital services

- Proven track record hitting/exceeding quota in a high-velocity sales environment

- SMB sales chops—you know how to build urgency, handle objections, and close without lengthy procurement cycles

- Consultative selling skills—you diagnose before prescribing and can articulate ROI clearly

- Comfort with ambiguity—you’re joining an early-stage startup where adaptability matters

- CRM proficiency (Zoho, HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.) and strong process discipline

- Excellent English communication skills for engaging with global prospects

- Want to hustle like crazy to hit the numbers!



Bonus Points For:



- Experience selling to manufacturers, distributors, or industrial/B2B companies

- Background in SEO, content marketing, or lead generation solutions

- Track record in 1-3 call close environments

- Familiarity with AI-powered products

- Experience selling to US/international markets



What We Offer:



- Accelerators for over-quota performance—top performers earn significantly more

description:
How to Apply

About us:



Gushwork.ai builds AI Agents that help small and medium businesses automate their entire inbound marketing stack — from SEO and website content to reviews, blogs, and lead funnels. Our current focus is the manufacturing and industrial distributors industry.



In plain English: we’re replacing bloated marketing agencies with intelligent, always-on software.



Backed by Lightspeed, SIG, Beenext, and B Capital, Gushwork.ai is one of the fastest-growing AI companies globally.



In just a year, we’ve grown to $1.5M ARR and are scaling fast toward $15M ARR in the next 12 months — helping thousands of small businesses grow smarter, not harder.



The Role:



We’re looking for a closer who thrives in fast-paced, high-velocity sales environments. You’ll own the full sales cycle from discovery to close for qualified meetings booked by our 10-person BDR team. This is a quota-carrying role where you’ll close 4-8 deals monthly, with deal cycles ranging from 1-3 calls.

- Ongoing: Maintain 30%+ demo-to-close conversion rate and sub-30 day sales cycles



You’re a Great Fit If You Have:



- 2-4 years of closing experience in B2B SaaS, MarTech, or digital services

- Proven track record hitting/exceeding quota in a high-velocity sales environment

- SMB sales chops—you know how to build urgency, handle objections, and close without lengthy procurement cycles

- Consultative selling skills—you diagnose before prescribing and can articulate ROI clearly

- Comfort with ambiguity—you’re joining an early-stage startup where adaptability matters

- CRM proficiency (Zoho, HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.) and strong process discipline

- Excellent English communication skills for engaging with global prospects

- Want to hustle like crazy to hit the numbers!



Bonus Points For:



- Experience selling to manufacturers, distributors, or industrial/B2B companies

- Background in SEO, content marketing, or lead generation solutions

- Track record in 1-3 call close environments

- Familiarity with AI-powered products

- Experience selling to US/international markets



What We Offer:



- Accelerators for over-quota performance—top performers earn significantly more

- Qualified pipeline delivered daily by our BDR team—focus on closing, not prospecting

- Fast feedback loops—short sales cycles mean you learn and earn quickly

- Career growth—as we scale, top performers move into senior AE or team lead roles

- Equity in a VC-backed rocketship

- Collaborative, high-performance culture where wins are celebrated and losses are learning 
nts

- Remote work



Our Sales Process

- Call 1: Discovery (30-45 min) - understand business, pain points, buying process

- Call 2: Demo + Proposal (45-60 min) - tailored walkthrough, ROI discussion, pricing

- Call 3 (if needed): Negotiation/Close - handle final objections, terms, signatures

title: Appointment Setter & Lead Qualifier
description:
We are a fast-growing, multiple six-figure tutoring company based in Michigan, USA. While we provide academic support across multiple subjects (Math, English, Science, Foreign Languages), SAT prep is our primary focus and core offering.



Due to continued growth in demand for our SAT programs, we are expanding our team and hiring an additional full-time member to support our increasing volume of inbound SAT leads. Although most of our clients are local to Michigan, we proudly serve families across the U.S.



The Role

You will call warm parent leads who opted in through our SAT-focused
 ads and scheduled a 5-minute SAT Accelerator callback. Your primary responsibility is simple and focused:



Have a short, professional phone conversation with parents and secure a 30-minute SAT Skills Assessment via Zoom with one of our SAT Specialists.



• Average call duration: 4–6 minutes.

• Calls are made using the WAVV power dialer in GHL (GoHighLevel), creating a fast, seamless workflow.

• You are not responsible for closing sales or enrolling families into the program.



All calls are made by following a detailed, step-by-step script that we provide. This role rewards clear delivery, confidence, and consistency, not improvisation.



Core Responsibilities

• Call warm SAT-focused parent leads who have already requested information or a callback.

• Use the WAVV power dialer to efficiently move through scheduled callbacks.

• Follow a detailed call script to ensure consistent, professional conversations.

• Build rapport with parents while staying structured and on-script.

• Gather key student background information (grade, testing history, goals).

• Confidently answer common questions using approved SAT talking points.

• Book qualified leads for Zoom appointments with our SAT Specialists.

• Follow up with previously contacted or missed-call leads.

• Accurately track call outcomes, notes, and lead status/disposition in our CRM (GoHighLevel).



Performance Expectations

• Expected pace after ramp-up: 16–24 qualified Zoom bookings per day.

• Consistent adherence to scripts and workflows.

• Strong attention to detail when documenting calls.

• Ability to stay composed, persuasive, and efficient on short (4–6 minute) calls.



What We’re Looking For

• Excellent spoken English (clear, fluent, confident; neutral or native-level accent).

• Prior experience in appointment setting, lead qualification, or phone-based customer interaction.

• Comfortable following scripts while sounding natural and conversational.

• Strong rapport-building skills with parents.

• Coachable, reliable, and performance-driven.



Technical & Environment Requirements

• Laptop or desktop with at least 16 GB RAM.

• High-speed, stable internet (backup connection preferred).

• Quiet, professional workspace.

• Noise-canceling headset.

• Ability to work Michigan / EST hours (40 hours per week).

• Backup power or contingency plan for outages (strongly preferred).



IMPORTANT: Please apply only if you already have a second monitor or are willing to set one up within your first 7 days. A dual-monitor setup is essential for this role.



Compensation & Benefits

• 100% remote.

• $5 per qualified Zoom appointment booked.

• Paid every Friday.



A “qualified Zoom appointment booked” means that the parent meets our minimum criteria.



Typical earnings:

• $400/week with 16 qualified bookings per day.

• $600+/week with 24+ qualified bookings per day.



How to Apply

1. Watch this video and follow all instructions carefully:



2. Submit a link to your CV (Google Drive or similar). Please make sure we can access/view it.

3. Include a short audio or video recording of you speaking in English (introduce yourself and explain why you’re a good fit).



Important Notes

• We are hiring freelancers / independent contractors only.

• Attention to detail matters. Applicants who do not follow instructions will not receive a reply.

• Do not message our social media accounts or
 addresses.

• Do not call our company lines or personal phone numbers. Doing so will result in immediate disqualification.



Hiring Process

• Due to the high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

• Qualified applicants will be invited to an interview within one week.

title: Amazon Specialist / Virtual Assistant
description:
Amazon Specialist / Virtual Assistant (Day Shift, Long-Term, Full-Time)



We are looking for a reliable, long-term Amazon Specialist / Virtual Assistant to support the daily operations of an established Amazon FBA business selling primarily in the German market.



This is a hands-on operational role. You will manage Amazon Seller Central tasks end-to-end, support customer communication, and assist the CEO with day-to-day coordination and admin work. This role is not a short-term or trial position.



Key Responsibilities



Amazon FBA Operations



Manage day-to-day Amazon Seller Central operations



Create, optimize, and maintain product listings (SEO and conversion focused)



Handle inventory planning, FBA shipment creation, and reconciliation



Open and resolve Amazon cases efficiently



Monitor account health and proactively flag risks or issues



Customer Support



Handle buyer messages, reviews, and returns according to SOPs



Manage customer support workflows inside and outside Seller Central (when applicable)



Ensure clear, professional, and timely communication with customers



Administrative & Operational Support



Provide personal VA support to the CEO (task coordination, follow-ups, basic admin)



Assist with updating basic financial and operational data



Support supply chain coordination (suppliers, restock timelines, shipment tracking)



Follow up on open tasks, deadlines, and pending actions



Coordinate with suppliers and external service providers



Handle ad-hoc administrative or operational tasks as needed



Tools & Communication



Use AI and translation tools (e.g. ChatGPT, DeepL) daily to work with German-language content



Provide daily progress updates and clear status reports



Proactively communicate problems, delays, or improvement opportunities



Requirements



Proven experience managing Amazon Seller Central



Strong organizational skills and attention to detail



Ability to follow SOPs and take ownership of tasks end-to-end



Comfortable using AI and translation tools in daily work



Reliable communication and consistent availability



Self-driven, proactive, and problem-solving mindset



Long-term commitment required



What We Offer



Long-term, stable position (no short-term contracts)



Clear SOPs and structured workflows



Direct collaboration with the business owner



Growing business with increasing responsibility over time 



Working hours: Full-time, Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM

title: Experienced Credit Repair Customer Service
description:
Customer Service Representative (Full-Time)



Company: Lyle Consulting LLC

Position Type: Full-Time

Hours: 40 hours per week (8 hours per day)



About Us



Lyle Consulting LLC is a fast-growing credit repair and funding company focused on real results, strong systems, and long-term client relationships. We are building a serious, structured team and are looking for long-term partners, not short-term freelancers.



You will be part of an established operation with clear SOPs, support, and growth opportunities.



Responsibilities



As a Customer Service Representative, you will be the primary point of contact for clients after they enroll. Your role is to maintain clear communication, organization, and client satisfaction while following company SOPs.





Client Communication

==================================================

Responding to inbound client messages via SMS,
, and CRM



Answering client questions about:



Credit repair process timelines



Dispute cycles and expectations



Required documentation



Account status updates



Providing professional, clear, and confident communication at all times



Account & Case Management



Reviewing client accounts and notes before responding



Requesting missing documents and follow-ups when needed



Uploading and organizing client documents in the CRM



Escalating issues to management or disputing team when necessary



Updating client notes accurately after each interaction



Retention & Follow-Ups



Following up with inactive or unresponsive clients



Reducing chargebacks and cancellations through proper communication



Ensuring clients understand the process and remain engaged



Supporting renewals and long-term client retention



Upselling Clients On New Services



Calling them to ensure no problems





Daily Workflow

============================

Following company SOPs exactly



Managing assigned ticket queues or message inboxes



Maintaining response time standards



Handling a high volume of client conversations daily





Requirements

==================================

Prior customer service experience required



Very fluent English, written and spoken



Strong communication and problem-solving skills



Excellent organization and attention to detail



Reliable internet connection and computer



Ability to work independently and meet daily productivity goals



Strong work ethic, accountability, and professionalism



Team-oriented mindset





Strongly Preferred (May Affect Hiring Decision)

============================================

Good English Accent (Dosen't have to be perfect but at least sound fluent so around B2-A2 Mastery)

Experience in credit repair, funding, or financial services



Experience using GoHighLevel or similar CRM



Experience handling sensitive client information





What We Offer

==================================

Full training with detailed SOPs provided



Long-term job security



Structured, supportive team environment



Performance-based incentives and bonuses



Growth opportunities into senior customer service or operations roles



Company incentives such as bonuses and potential company getaways



You are treated as a long-term partner, not just an employee





How to Apply (Very Important)

-------------------------------------------------------

To be considered, all applicants must submit the following:



A detailed written explanation of why you are a strong fit for this role



Short or generic applications will not be considered



A Loom video or short introduction video explaining:



Your customer service experience



Any experience in credit repair or financial services



Why you are seeking a long-term role



Submitting a video significantly increases your chances of being hired.



We are only interested in serious applicants who want stability, growth, and a long-term role with a structured company. If you are disciplined, detail-oriented, and client-focused, we would love to hear from you.

title: Video Editor (Anime Reaction Videos – Long & Short Form)
description:
We’re looking for a reliable Video Editor to help with anime reaction content for YouTube.



This role focuses on efficient, repeatable edits. Most edits are straightforward cutting, trimming, syncing, and exporting. A full tutorial and workflow will be provided to make editing as fast and consistent as possible.



- What you’ll be editing

Anime reaction videos (long-form YouTube)

Face-cam + reaction footage already recorded

7–14 videos per week initially

Can increase to 28+ videos per week depending on performance and availability

Videos usually take 20–30 minutes to edit



- Payment

Paid per video

Test video is required and will be paid

Long-term work available for the right person



- Requirements

Good spoken and written English

Strong working knowledge of Adobe Premiere Pro

Able to follow a clear editing template and workflow

Reliable, responsive, and consistent

Interest in anime is a major plus



- Nice to have

Experience editing reaction videos

Comfortable working to deadlines

This is a long-term position for someone who wants steady work, clear expectations, and simple editing tasks.

mbers

title: CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist (Ivorey / GHL)
description:
Purpose of the Role

This role exists to build, configure, and optimize our Ivorey (GoHighLevel-based) system so it becomes the central hub for client communication, marketing visibility, KPIs, and internal task management.



Your work will directly impact client retention, marketing performance, team accountability, and the owner’s ability to make fast, data-driven decisions.



Key Responsibilities

- Set up and maintain Ivorey pipelines for:

- New client acquisition

- Existing client re-engagement

- Internal operations and tasks

- Build and optimise workflows for:

- Booking confirmations and reminders

- Two-way SMS communication

- Missed appointment and follow-up sequences

- Post-appointment nurture and rebooking prompts

- Integrate Acuity Scheduling with Ivorey using Zapier:

- Sync bookings, reschedules, cancellations, and no-shows

- Ensure all client communication is handled through Ivorey

- Design and maintain KPI dashboards inside Ivorey:

- Revenue tracking

- Client retention and rebooking rates

- Marketing pipeline conversion

- Staff performance metrics

- Create and manage custom business KPIs aligned with salon goals

- Set up task management inside Ivorey to replace Asana:

- Task pipelines

- Task templates

- Staff assignments and deadlines

- Troubleshoot workflow issues and continuously improve system efficiency



Essential Skills and Qualifications

- Proven experience working with GoHighLevel or Ivorey

- Strong understanding of CRM pipelines and automation workflows

- Experience integrating third-party tools via Zapier

- Confident working with booking systems such as Acuity Scheduling

- Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into actionable insights

- Excellent written communication and attention to detail

- Ability to work independently and document processes clearly



Preferred Skills (Optional)

- Experience in the beauty, wellness, or service-based industry

- Familiarity with Stripe payment data and revenue tracking

- Experience building KPI dashboards for business owners

- Understanding of client lifecycle marketing and retention strategies

- Graphic design/canva experience



Performance Metrics

- Success in this role will be measured by:

- Fully functioning pipelines with clear visibility of leads, bookings, and conversions

- Automated workflows reducing manual admin and follow-ups

- Accurate, easy-to-read KPI dashboards for revenue, retention, and staff performance

- Successful transition of task management from Asana into Ivorey

- Reduction in missed appointments and improvement in rebooking rates



Team Structure

- Reports directly to the Business Owner

- Works closely with our admin assistant/social media manager



Company Values and Culture

- Tempest & Bloom values clarity, accountability, and high standards.

- We care deeply about client experience, smart systems, and building a business that supports both growth and quality of life. We value initiative, problem-solving, and people who can think strategically while executing with precision.



Compensation Range

- Hourly rate between AU$5 to AU$15 to be negotiated based on experience and demonstrated expertise with Ivorey/GHL.



Application Process

To apply, please answer this form:



Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a brief discussion to ensure alignment before moving forward.

title: YouTube Video Editor (On-Call / Long-Term)
description:
I am looking for a skilled and dependable YouTube video editor to work on an on-call / as-needed basis.



This is a long-term opportunity, but hours are not guaranteed. Work is provided only when new videos are created. This position is ideal for someone who already has other clients but wants steady, recurring editing work with a clear process and consistent standards.



What You’ll Be Editing



Talking-head educational / informational YouTube videos



Clean, professional style (not flashy or over-edited)



Focus on clarity, pacing, and viewer retention



Responsibilities



Video Editing



Cut mistakes, long pauses, and filler words



Add simple zooms, cuts, and smooth transitions



Insert royalty-free background music when needed



Follow editing notes and brand style consistently



Deliver edits on time once a video is assigned



Thumbnail Creation



Design click-worthy YouTube thumbnails



Strong contrast, readable text, clean layout



Optimized for mobile and desktop viewing



Requirements



2+ years experience editing YouTube videos



Strong understanding of YouTube pacing and retention



Experience editing educational or talking-head content



Basic graphic design skills for thumbnails



Good English comprehension



Reliable, responsive, and detail-oriented



Open to feedback and willing to improve



Able to work independently with minimal supervision



Technical Requirements



Stable wired internet connection (minimum 5 Mbps)



Quiet, distraction-free home workspace



Updated PC or laptop capable of video editing



Must be willing to use TimeProof for time tracking



Job Details



Pay: $3 USD per hour



Work Type: On-call / As needed



Hours: Not guaranteed (depends on video production)



Payment Method: PayPal



Location: Home-based 



How to Apply



Please include:



Links to YouTube videos you personally edited



A short description of your experience



Editing software you use (Premiere Pro, CapCut, Final Cut, etc.)



To confirm you read this post carefully, start your application with the word “ONCALL.”



This role is best suited for someone who values long-term cooperation, clear expectations, and consistent quality, even with flexible hours.

title: Full Time Designer
description:
Want To Turn Your Passion For Beautiful Design Into a Purposeful and Profitable Career?



We’re looking for an experienced designer to join our Trident Digital Team both full-time and part-time!



As the designer of our company, you will be responsible for creating and designing engaging and on-brand graphics for the company for a variety of media. 



Materials that we normally produce include social media graphics, posters, workbooks, newsletter, logos, and other publication and marketing materials.



Since appealing and engaging publication materials are now also considered as one of the top and modern ways now to attract more people in and get them more interested in a brand, your position will play an important role in the team’s success.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



Work with our creative teammates

Follow the company’s branding guidelines

Regularly communicate and collaborate with the marketing and designs team

Establish a clear understanding of the outcome and purpose for each output production

Secure that all projects, templates, and raw/finalized media files are properly transferred, organized, documented and uploaded in our online library

Conceptualize visuals based on requirements

Create templates for different types of graphics to be edited

Edit social media graphics, posters, workbooks, logos, and other publication and marketing materials

Present all designs / outputs to the team for evaluation

Test graphics across various media

Ensure final graphics and layouts are visually appealing and on-brand

Initiate to explore and propose strategies on how to further make our graphics more engaging and attractive to our target market

Continuously discover and implement new editing technologies and industry’s best practices to maximize efficiency



REQUIREMENT



Has a background experience in designing

Is very knowledgeable on using Adobe Apps and other digital designing tools

Knowledgeable on creating digital arts (digital drawings, doodles etc.)

Can design for both digital and print materials

Has a strong portfolio of illustrations or other graphics

Is familiar with the trends and best practices of designers for producing attractive and engaging materials 

Has a keen eye for aesthetics and details

Has the ability to work methodically and meet deadlines

Has the ability to multitask and work toward several milestones on various projects simultaneously

Possesses excellent communication skills

And lastly, has a strong desire to improve and grow with the team!







HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL BE DESIGNING FOR US IF YOU BECOME PART OF THE TEAM...



LOGOS

You will be responsible for conceptualizing and designing our logos for the programs that we create (ex. Logos for group of clients, for the services/products we provide, for Podcast / Online content series, and so on.)





T-SHIRT DESIGNS



You’ll be responsible for the designing of T-shirts that we’ll use for our events



EVENT POSTERS



You’ll be responsible for the designing of our event posters for our Webinars, Masterclasses, Masterminds, etc.



WORKBOOKS



You’ll be responsible for the designing of our Masterclass and Mastermind workbooks





NEWSLETTER / LEAD MAGNETS



You’ll be responsible for the designing of our newsletter and lead magnets using the copies we will be providing for you





SOCIAL MEDIA GRAPHICS



For the social media graphics, this can vary in different formats as listed below:



Cover Photos

You’ll be tasked to design cover photos for FB pages, FB groups, FB event reminder cover photo etc.



Social Media Content and Publication Materials



You’ll be responsible for the designing of the graphics and publication materials that we post online, commonly on Instagram and
 (Examples are IG carousel posts, quote cards, announcements, etc.)



AND OTHERS…



Since our company loves to produce awesome ideas, there will be times where we will be asking you to produce designs for other materials such as nametags, cards, website photos, video thumbnails, envelope designs, print for our welcome boxes to our clients, etc...





[TAKE THIS SIMPLE TEST BEFORE YOU APPLY]



Before you apply, take this simple 6 step test to find if this role is suitable for you or not.



1) Check out the work we do at our website and Instagram page









If you don’t find these transformations and results appealing to your heart and don’t want to be a part of it - don’t apply.



2) If you are NOT excited to edit and create similar types of designs - don’t apply



3) Ask yourself, “Do I see myself creating, designing and being near designs for the next 3 years?” If the answer is no, don’t apply.



4) Ask yourself, “Do I see myself exploring and working with this elite team for at least the next 3 years?” If the answer is no, don’t apply.



5) Ask yourself, “Do I see myself working full-time; and extra hours not because I have to, but because I've lost track of time?” If the answer is no, don’t apply.



6) Ask yourself, “Do I believe I’m great at what I do and do it much better than most people?” If the answer is no, don’t apply.



[IF YOU D
 THAT YOU’VE PASSED THE 6 STEP TEST ABOVE]



Follow my instructions carefully and do all 4 steps below..



1. Send an
 to 
 with the subject line: “EAGLE”



2. In your
, tell me how you “pass” the 6 step test above. Give me supporting information on how you see yourself achieving all of those 6 criteria above.



3. Attach a link to your online portfolio



4. Also, tell me ONE thing about yourself that your friends/parents may not even know.

title: Senior Shopify Landing Page Developer
description:
We are looking for a senior-level Shopify Landing Page Developer who specializes in building high-converting, performance-driven landing pages within the Shopify ecosystem. This role is ideal for someone who combines strong front-end execution with a marketer’s mindset and can move fast without sacrificing quality.



You will work closely with the Marketing Director, Creative Team, and E-Commerce Manager to build landing pages for campaigns, funnels, and product launches using Shopify best practices.



Key Responsibilities



1 - Own the full build process for Shopify landing pages from wireframes to final publish

2 - Build fast, mobile-first pages using Shopify themes, Liquid, custom sections, and app integrations

3 - Collaborate with the Marketing Director on funnels, CRO strategies, and campaign landing pages

4 - Translate Figma or Canva designs into pixel-accurate Shopify pages

5 - Optimize pages for speed, SEO fundamentals, and user experience

6 - Maintain, update, and improve existing landing pages across multiple Shopify stores

7 - Troubleshoot layout issues, theme conflicts, and app compatibility problems

8 - Create reusable components, templates, and documentation to streamline future builds

9 - Implement tracking scripts, pixels, UTMs, and custom events when required

10 - Proactively recommend improvements to increase conversion rates and performance



Requirements



1 - 3+ years of hands-on experience building Shopify stores, landing pages, or custom themes

2 - Strong proficiency in Shopify Liquid, custom sections, CSS, and responsive design

3 - Experience working with marketing teams on direct-response pages, funnels, and CRO initiatives

4 - Solid understanding of Shopify apps, metafields, variants, and theme architecture

5 - High attention to detail across layouts, spacing, and design consistency

6 - Ability to manage multiple page builds and deadlines in a fast-moving environment

7 - Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate closely with designers and marketers

8 - Experience optimizing page speed, image compression, and clean front-end code



Preferred but Not Required



1 - Experience working from Figma files and structured design handoffs

2 - Experience with advanced Liquid logic or custom Shopify functionality

3 - Familiarity with tools such as Shogun, PageFly, Replo, or GemPages

4 - Basic understanding of analytics, conversion tracking, and split testing



How to Apply



Please send your CV, portfolio links, and a short summary of your Shopify landing page experience.

title: People Operations & Hiring Manager (Virtual / Remote)
description:
About Us



We are a growing healthcare services company operating with a lean, distributed team. We prioritize clear processes, accountability, and strong execution over bureaucracy.



We are hiring a People Operations & Hiring Manager (Virtual) to own the end-to-end people operations function, including recruiting, interviewing, hiring, onboarding, and team integration.



This is a hands-on execution role, not a policy or strategy position. You will be responsible for making sure the right people are hired, onboarded correctly, and fully integrated into the team with minimal friction.



Core Responsibilities

Recruiting & Talent Sourcing



Proactively source candidates for roles across operations, sales support, and administrative functions



Post job descriptions to relevant platforms and manage inbound applicants



Screen resumes and conduct initial interviews



Coordinate interviews with leadership and hiring managers



Maintain a strong candidate pipeline for current and future roles



Hiring & Onboarding



Manage offer communication and hiring logistics



Coordinate onboarding checklists and timelines



Collect required documentation and agreements



Set up new hires with access to systems, tools, and accounts



Ensure new tea
mbers are fully ready on Day 1



Access & Systems Management



Provision and revoke access to internal tools 
, CRM, project tools, shared drives, etc.)



Coordinate with IT or operations for system access when needed



Maintain accurate records of team access and roles



Ensure offboarding is handled cleanly and securely



Team Integration & People Operations



Ensure new hires are introduced and integrated into the team



Schedule onboarding calls and initial check-ins



Maintain employee records and basic HR documentation



Track roles, responsibilities, and reporting structures



Support leadership with basic people operations needs



This role does not provide legal HR advice or manage payroll/taxes. External providers handle those functions.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Prior experience recruiting, hiring, and onboarding tea
mbers



Strong interview and candidate evaluation skills



Highly organized with excellent follow-through



Comfortable working independently and owning processes end-to-end



Experience working with remote or virtual teams



Reliable internet and consistent availability



Clear written and verbal English communication



Preferred Experience (Strong Plus)



Experience hiring virtual assistants or remote tea
mbers



Experience supporting healthcare, operations, or regulated businesses



Familiarity with tools like Google Workspace, Slack, Notion, ClickUp, Pipedrive, or similar



Experience setting up onboarding SOPs and checklists



Experience coordinating access and permissions across tools



What This Role Is Not



Not a legal or compliance HR role



Not a payroll or benefits administrator



Not a culture or engagement strategy role



Not a passive coordinator — this is an execution role



You are responsible for making hiring and onboarding work smoothly, end to end.



Performance Expectations



Open roles are filled efficiently with qualified candidates



Hiring processes run without delays or confusion



New hires are fully onboarded and productive quickly



Access and permissions are set up correctly every time



Leadership does not need to chase or micromanage HR tasks



Compensation & Structure



Monthly compensation based on experience



Fully remote / virtual role



Long-term opportunity for strong performers



Clear ownership and responsibilities

title: Pricelab Revenue Manager
description:
Job Title: Part-Time Revenue Manager (Short-Term Rental | PriceLabs)



Overview:

We are looking for an experienced Revenue Manager with strong PriceLabs expertise to manage pricing for one short-term rental property. This is a fractional, part-time role focused on owning pricing decisions end-to-end with minimal supervision.

This individual should be confident managing PriceLabs independently and optimizing revenue based on market demand.

Responsibilities:

• Fully manage pricing using PriceLabs

• Set and adjust base price, seasonal profiles, min-stay rules, and price floors/ceilings

• Monitor local market trends, demand pacing, and competitor pricing

• Optimize weekends, holidays, and local events

• Strategically manage gap/orphan nights

• Prevent underpricing during high-demand periods

• Make proactive pricing adjustments

• Provide a short monthly summary (what changed, why, and overall performance direction)

Success Looks Like:

• Improved revenue efficiency (ADR / RevPAR / RevPAN)

• Fewer missed high-demand pricing opportunities

• Confident, independent pricing decisions

• Minimal need for direction or follow-up



Requirements:

• Proven experience using PriceLabs for short-term rentals

• Strong understanding of STR pricing strategy (ADR vs occupancy)

• Experience pricing Airbnb or similar platforms

• Ability to work independently and explain decisions clearly



Schedule:

• Part-time 

• Flexible hours (results-focused, not time-based)



Compensation:

• $200–$350 USD per month, based on experience

• Additional $100 USD if property booked more than 50% per month

• 90-day probationary period

• Opportunity to grow and scale the company



To Apply, Please Include:

1.  Experience with PriceLabs IS A MUST

2. STR markets or listings you’ve managed

3. How you approach pricing for a single STR

4. Confirmation that you can fully own pricing decisions without supervision
