title: HR Administrator & Compliance Specialist (Database & Audit Focus)  - $500 - $700 USD/ month
description:
About Oprisa GmbH: We are a rapidly expanding German company managing a massive fleet of couriers for major Food Delivery Platform across Germany. We operate in a high-speed environment where compliance is just as important as recruitment.



Job Summary: We are looking for a "Gatekeeper". While our Recruiters are the "Hunters" bringing people in, you are the "Shield" that protects the company. Your main mission is Compliance & Data Integrity. You will manage the onboarding of hundreds of drivers, audit their documents daily, and ensure that our Google Drive/Database is 100% audit-proof for German authorities.



Key Responsibilities:



The "Uber Audit" Defense: Review every single driver document (ID, Work Permit, Licenses) for validity and clarity before activation.



Database Management: Own the Master Sheet. Ensure every cell is filled, every file is renamed correctly in Dropbox, and every expiration date is tracked.



Onboarding Execution: Generate contracts, send welcome packs, and chase drivers for missing signatures.



Compliance Enforcer: If a driver’s ID is expired, you flag it immediately. You do not let "bad data" enter the system.



Reporting: Assist the Fleet Manager in generating weekly headcount and compliance reports.



Required Qualifications:



Eagle Eye for Detail: You spot a typo or an expired date from a mile away. You hate messy spreadsheets.



Experience: Proven background in HR Admin, Data Entry, or Compliance Support (BPO experience preferred).



Tech Stack: Comfortable with Google Sheets (Filter, Sort, basic Formulas), Dropbox/Google Drive organization, and Slack.



Communication: Assertive English. You need to tell drivers (and sometimes managers) "No, this document is not good enough."



The Offer:



Stable Salary: $500 - $700 USD/Month (based on experience).



Low Stress, High Focus: Unlike phone support, this role focuses on documents and data accuracy.



Long-Term Security: We are looking for someone to stay and grow with our Operations team.



Schedule:



Full-Time (40 Hours/Week).



Must overlap 4-5 hours with German Business Time (Afternoon/Evening in Philippines).



HOW TO APPLY: Please apply directly through this platform. Note: To prove your attention to detail, please start your cover letter/message with the exact phrase: "I AM THE GATEKEEPER". Applications without this phrase will be ignored.

Admin Assistant

Data Entry

HR Management

Google Suite (Docs, Sheets)

Attention to Detail

English (Writing)

title: Junior Social Media Content Creator

In this role, you’ll be responsible for turning long-form videos into a variety of engaging micro-content across platforms like Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and LinkedIn. If you love creating 
s, Reels, quote cards, captions, and interactive content—and enjoy seeing your work drive real engagement—this is the perfect role for you.

s, and captions

mbers to align content with brand goals and campaigns

NICE TO HAVE

title: Data Entry Specialist
description:
Work From Home – Long-Term Opportunity



We are looking for reliable and detail-oriented workers from the Philippines to help decode handwritten information from scanned documents and enter the data accurately into our system. Full training is provided. Immediate hiring.



Position Details



Job Title: Handwriting Decoder / Data Entry Specialist

Hours: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM PST (California Time)

Equivalent PH Time: 1:00 AM – 9:00 AM PHT

Work Duration: 40 hours per week

Start Date: Immediately after the interview (same day)



Job Description



You will review scanned handwritten forms, interpret the names, addresses, and signature details, and enter them into our database. This job requires accuracy, consistency, and strong attention to detail.



Training will be provided on the first day.



Compensation

• Training Day Payment: 1,000 PHP paid the same day if you stay until 5 PM PST (even if not hired)

• Trial Week (Week 1): 5,000 PHP

• Weekly Salary After Trial: 5,000–6,000 PHP/week based on performance

• Payment Method: Weekly via Wise (TransferWise) only

• Applicants must have or create a Wise account to receive payment.



Requirements

• Ability to work 9 AM–5 PM PST (1 AM–9 AM PHT) for the first week - flexible hours from week 2.

• Fast and stable internet

• Desktop or laptop in good condition (not mobile)

• Strong attention to detail

• Ability to read and interpret handwritten text

• Must have Signal Messenger installed on phone and computer (team communication)

• Must join the interview with your camera ON

• Must have or be willing to create a Wise account for payments



Mandatory Interview Details



All applicants must attend the interview:



US Time: Wednesday, February 4 – 9:00 AM PST

Philippines Time: Thursday, February 5 – 1:00 AM PHT

Interview Link: 
/kqk-dajg-oqy

Camera required.



If hired, you will begin working immediately after the interview and complete a full eight-hour training shift until 5 PM PST.



How to Apply



Please apply by sending the following message:



“I can work 9 AM–5 PM PST and I will attend the interview on Feb 4th at 9 AM PST.”



We look forward to meeting you.



Please go back and read this entire post again to make sure you understand it and follow all steps.

title: e - Commerce Team Leader (Work from Home)
description:
Bean Ninjas is looking for an Accounting Team Lead

A Philippine CPA license is highly preferred.

Experience in overseeing a team of accountants in a remote / work-from-home setup is required.



The ideal candidate will take charge of reviewing tea
mbers' work output from the bookkeeping process to the management reports.



The Filipino candidate must possess the following (Please do not apply if you do not have the following):



~ 5+ years of full-time accounting experience within a BPO or similar environment.

~  end-to-end bookkeeping experience, including preparation of Balance Sheet and Income Statement

~ Proficient in cloud accounting software and platforms.

~ Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.

~ Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

~ Bachelor's degree in Accounting, CPA preferred

~ Has Xero and/or QuickBooks Online experience

~ Oversee and train junior and senior accountants under her/his team who handle multiple clients (required)



Qualifications for the role:



- Full-time work (Mon-Fri) for our US clients within the Philippines working hours of 8 am to 5 pm (with a bit of flexibility on the schedule).

- We also offer flexibility on the schedule at work once you are familiar with the processes and client work.

- Excellent attention to detail and time management skills.

- Experience in eCommerce bookkeeping highly preferred

- Team player who would get along well with the rest of the Bean Ninjas team

- Has experience using Xero and QBO add-ons and integrations like Hubdoc, A2X, 
, Stripe, Gusto and PayPal

-You write well: concise, understandable, helpful, professional, and fast. You can build rapport with others solely through your writing.



Who are we?

Bean Ninjas is a bookkeeping and financial reporting business founded on Australia’s Gold Coast in 2015.



We specialise in eCommerce businesses, and our mission is to create financial freedom through stress-free business finances for our clients.





What’s it like being part of the Bean Ninjas team?



Career development

We believe in developing our team and promoting internally. You will go through an initial 6-month training program and will then receive ongoing training and mentoring. We prepare individual staff development plans for each tea
mber.



Flexible and remote role

This is a remote role and you will have some level of flexibility in choosing your regular work hours, but must generally be online during Philippine working hours.



Benefits

We offer a variety of benefits from 13th-month pay, birthday vouchers, birthday time off, accrued leaves, and Christmas shutdown leave (where everyone does not need to log in to work for a couple of days during the Christmas shutdown which is usually 5 to 7 working days, yet these days are still paid for by the company!), 6-week maternity leave, remote social activities, and pieces of training and up to date certifications for our accountants on various accounting platforms or integrations.



Bean Ninjas is recognized as an industry leader. You will be working alongside Chartered Accountants and CPAs who have come from firms such as Ernst and Young, BDO, and Grant Thornton.



We won the Xero Australia Bookkeeping Partner of the Year Award in 2019 and the equivalent state award for Queensland in both 2017 and 2019.



Applications can be sent to 
 and include a copy of your resume. Please do not apply if you have no relevant experience or are only looking for a project-based role. Thank you!
salary: up to 90,000 pesos plus other perks

title: Administrative Support Assistant
description:
A Company Overview  



BE SmartAdmin Services Pty Ltd (BESAS) is an Australian-based company providing highly skilled virtual assistants from the Philippines to support Australian businesses. We specialise in administrative, operational, and bookkeeping solutions, helping companies streamline processes, improve efficiency, and achieve their business goals. 



For this role, you will be deployed to a leading Australian testing and inspection company based in Darwin, Northern Territory. This client provides NATA-accredited materials testing services across Western Australia and the Northern Territory, servicing government, defence, construction, and mining sectors. They are known for their technical expertise, precision, and commitment to delivering reliable, high-quality results. 



Working with this tea
ans contributing to projects that have a direct impact on construction quality and safety standards across Australia. If you thrive in a detail-oriented, dynamic environment and want to be part of a team that values accuracy, reliability, and continuous improvement, this role is perfect for you. 



Role Overview 



We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Administrative Support Assistant (Virtual Assistant) to join our remote team. This full-time, home-based role involves providing administrative support across multiple areas, including Work Health & Safety (WHS), reporting, policy management, vehicle management, and HR-related tasks. 



This is a critical role ensuring smooth operations, accurate reporting, and timely completion of tasks that support the client’s day-to-day business functions. 



Key Responsibilities 



Work Health & Safety (WHS) 



   -  Create, update, and manage policies, SWMS, and risk assessments 

   -  Close out inductions and maintain WHS registers 



Reporting & Data Management 



   -  Extract data and compile reports (Vehicle, AP, INV, Payroll) 

   -  Support quarterly reporting processes, including template preparation and data validation 



Policy Management 



   -  Migrate and maintain policies 

   -  Conduct annual policy reviews and updates 

   -  Draft new policies as needed 



Vehicle Management 



   -  Maintain vehicle registers and pre-start processes 



HR & Administrative Support 



   -  Manage resumes and other HR-related documentation 

   -  Assist in coordinating schedules, project deadlines, and general administrative tasks 

   -  Ensure all tasks are completed accurately and on time 



General Administration 



   -  Contribute to process improvement initiatives 

   -  Maintain accuracy and compliance across all administrative activities 



Who We’re Looking For 



The ideal candidate is: 



   -  Highly detail-oriented, organised, and proactive 

   -  Skilled in advanced Microsoft Excel (formulas, pivot tables, data analysis) 

   -  Experienced in using Microsoft Office tools, including Word, Outlook, and Teams 

   -  Quick to learn new systems, processes, and software 

   -  Able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently 

   -  Trustworthy, reliable, and committed to a full-time remote role 

   -  Comfortable with a flexible workload, managing busy and lighter periods while meeting deadlines 



Qualifications & Experience 



   -  Minimum 3 years’ experience in administrative or operational support roles 

   -  Experience working in Australian business practices is advantageous 

   -  Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal 

   -  Familiarity with WHS, reporting, and policy management 

   -  Prior experience in data compilation, reporting, and basic bookkeeping is a plus 



Home Office Requirements 



   -  Stable power supply and internet connection (minimum 15 Mbps) 

   -  Working computer/laptop with at least 8GB RAM 

   -  Quiet home office setup suitable for client calls and tea
etings 



Working Hours 



   -  Monday to Friday, 7:00 AM – 3:30 PM Philippine Standard Time, including a 30-minute unpaid lunch break. This schedule aligns with the client’s operating hours of 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM Northern Territory (NT) time. Flexible scheduling may be accommodated and will be discussed with the client. 

   -  Use of Clockify to track 8-hour workday in detail, specifying tasks and time spent 

   -  Short tea breaks (up to 15 minutes, 2x per day) allowed with prior approval 



Compensation & Benefits 



   -  Premium rate: PHP 350/hour (billable work) 

   -  Base rate: PHP 200/hour (non-billable work, tea breaks, idle time) 

   -  Estimated monthly salary (100% billable, 40-hour week): approx. PHP 60,666.50 

   -  Salary paid in Philippine Pesos via Security Bank account 

   -  Offshore contractor status; voluntary contributions to SSS, HDMF, PhilHealth 

   -  Opportunities for salary progression after passing 6-month probation and meeting KPIs 



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) May Include: 



   -  Accurate and timely reporting 

   -  Effective WHS, policy, and vehicle management 

   -  Responsiveness and proactive communication 

   -  Process improvement and adherence to company procedures 



How to Apply 



If you are highly organised, detail-oriented, and excited to contribute to a high-performing, technical Australian company, please submit your CV to 
 us and be part of a team where accuracy, reliability, and operational excellence make a tangible impact!

title: SOCIAL MEDIA, BRAND & ECOMMERCE MANAGER
description:
We're looking for a creative, process-driven digital marketing all-rounder who can become the driving force behind our brand presence and online operations. This isn't just a "post on social media" role - you'll be shaping our brand identity, optimizing our digital marketing, managing our ecommerce operations, and creating the brand assets that position us as New Zealand's leading premium honey collective.



Salary and bonuses for success



**This role is perfect for you if:**

- You're equally comfortable creating beautiful social content AND setting up spreadsheets

- You love the creative side (design, storytelling, brand) but also enjoy systematic processes (order tracking, CRM updates, inventory)

- You get excited about food, sustainability, and authentic regional products

- You want to help build something meaningful, not just execute tasks

- You thrive with autonomy and take initiative without constant supervision



---



 Core Responsibilities



 1. SOCIAL MEDIA & CONTENT CREATION (40% of role)



**Instagram &
 (B2C Focus):**

- Create 12-15 engaging posts per week showcasing our honey varieties, regional stories, beekeeping insights, and customer experiences

- Use AI tools (ChatGPT/Claude) + Canva to produce scroll-stopping visuals with our premium-yet-fun brand voice

- Post educational content about bee biology, honey terroir, seasonal beekeeping, hayfever relief

- Engage with followers daily, respond to comments/DMs within 2 hours

- Run seasonal campaigns and promotions (e.g., "Taste of Marlborough Week")

- Create Instagram Stories/Reels showing behind-the-scenes beekeeping, product features, and regional landscapes



**LinkedIn (B2B Focus - CRITICAL):**

- Build professional relationships with hotel owners, restaurant managers, supermarket buyers, gift shop proprietors

- Share thought leadership content about sustainable beekeeping, regional food systems, tourism partnerships

- Connect with decision-makers in NZ hospitality and retail sectors

- Position Ray as an expert in premium regional honey and sustainable tourism products

- 3-5 LinkedIn posts per week focused on B2B storytelling



**Content Strategy:**

- Develop monthly content calendars aligned with seasons, holidays, and NZ tourist patterns

- Create blog posts and website content (1-2 per month) about honey varieties, beekeeping, recipes, regional stories

- Research trending topics in food tourism, sustainability, and NZ travel

- Suggest promotional campaigns and collaboration opportunities



 2. BRAND DEVELOPMENT & DESIGN (20% of role)



**Brand Identity Formalization:**

- Develop comprehensive brand style guide including:

  - Color palette (primary, secondary, accent colors with hex codes)

  - Typography (fonts for headings, body text, special uses)

  - Logo usage guidelines

  - Photography style and filters

  - Tone of voice guidelines ("premium quality, sustainable, with wit and fun")

  - Visual mood boards

- This is a ONE-TIME project in first 4 weeks, then maintain consistency



**Graphic Design & Brand Assets:**

- Create stockist resources: Product catalogs, sell sheets, wholesale price lists, POS materials

- Design promotional materials: Flyers,
 headers, social media templates, banner ads

- Organize complete brand asset library in Google Drive for easy team access

- Design product labels or packaging graphics as needed (coordinate with suppliers)

- Create gift set graphics and seasonal promotion designs

- Develop "Meet the Beekeeper" graphics for supplier features



**Website Updates (Shopify):**

- Add 1-2 new products per month with compelling descriptions that highlight terroir and regional storytelling

- Create deal/promotion landing pages

- Update homepage banners seasonally

- Basic Shopify maintenance (product variants, pricing updates, collection organization)

- Optimize product pages for SEO and conversions



 3. GOOGLE ADS OPTIMIZATION (10% of role)



**Campaign Management:**

- Review and optimize existing Google Ads campaigns (currently basic setup)

- Improve keyword targeting for honey varieties and regional searches

- Create compelling ad copy that converts tourists searching for NZ honey

- Set up conversion tracking and analyze performance

- A/B test ad variations

- Manage monthly budget efficiently (will provide budget parameters)

- Monthly performance reports with insights and recommendations



**Learning Opportunity:** If you haven't managed Google Ads before but are eager to learn, we'll support training. Must be comfortable with data analysis and willing to get Google Ads certified.



 4. ECOMMERCE & ORDER OPERATIONS (15% of role)



**Daily Order Processing:**

- Process 4-5 daily orders through Zoho Inventory

- Generate packing slips and prepare order information for local fulfillment team

- Coordinate with local order fulfillment assistant on shipping schedules

- Handle order issues (wrong addresses, special requests, delayed shipments)

- Manage customer communications about orders (tracking updates, delivery confirmations)

- Process refunds/exchanges when needed



**Inventory Management:**

- Monitor stock levels for 20 SKUs

- Update inventory in Zoho when new stock arrives

- Flag low inventory to Ray for reordering

- Coordinate with beekeepers on supply chain timing

- Seasonal inventory planning (high tourist season vs. low season)



 5. ADMINISTRATION & SYSTEMS (15% of role)



**Basic Accounting (Xero):**

- Enter invoices and bills

- Reconcile bank transactions (basic matching)

- Generate simple sales reports

- Tag expenses appropriately

- Note: You won't be doing complex accounting, just basic data entry and categorization



**CRM & Project Management (ClickUp):**

- Update ClickUp with completed tasks and project progress

- Chase action items and follow up on pending tasks

- Create tasks from
 requests or new initiatives

- Organize resources and attach relevant files to tasks

- Support Ray by keeping project tracking current



*
 Management:**

- Answer customer inquiries (product questions, delivery timing, honey info)

- Handle wholesale inquiries (pass qualified leads to Ray)

- Respond to partnership opportunities

- Maintain professional, friendly tone consistent with brand voice

- Response time goal:

title: Unity Technical Artist
description:
• We are a small mobile game studio with a live Unity product and a team of around 25 people worldwide, with a core team in Israel and distributed tea
mbers across Europe, Asia, and North America.

Our game creates direct real-world impact: players interact with real shelter dogs, and their in-game progress results in tangible support delivered to shelters, such as food, medicine and essential supplies - the work we do every day affects animals beyond the screen.



• We are looking for an experienced Technical Artist to take ownership of the technical execution of art in our Unity-based mobile game. In this role, you’ll sit between art and frontend development, ensuring assets are implemented efficiently, visuals maintain high quality, and everything performs well on mobile devices. You’ll work closely with the Art Director and frontend developers to bring content into the game in a clean, scalable way.



• Responsibilities:

- Implement UI, 2D/3D assets, animations, and VFX in Unity

- Set up and maintain materials, shaders, particles, animations, prefabs, and asset import settings

- Optimize shaders, textures, VFX, and atlases for mobile performance

- Ensure visuals are consistent, production-ready and compatible with existing UI

- Build and maintain a clear art/Unity pipeline for a live mobile game, including:

• • Asset standards and performance safety

• • Naming conventions and scalable project structure

- Support artists technically, reduce frontend developer workload, and collaborate with art and dev teams to resolve visual and technical issues



• Qualifications:

- 4+ years of hands-on experience working as a Technical Artist in Unity, including building or improving art pipelines in Unity-based games; preferably in startup or live-product environments

- Strong understanding of URP, real-time rendering, and mobile performance

- Practical experience with uGUI, Shader Graph, VFX Graph, and Unity animation systems

- Experience in implementing and optimizing game assets, including:

• • 3-slice and 9-slice UI

• • Atlases and sprite sheets

• • Fonts setup and management

• • Handling mobile-safe areas and notches

- Able to turn animatics and static design mocks or storyboards into clean in-engine results

- A good mix of visual sense and technical problem-solving

- Organized, pragmatic, and able to work within existing dev practices

- Professional, fluent English and clear communication skills

- Experience with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator

- Familiar with Jira, Confluence, Sheets, Docs and Slack/

- Comfortable using AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT) as part of daily workflow



• Bonus:

- Shader coding experience (HLSL / GLSL)

- Experience with Maya or Blender, Substance Painter

- Spine or other 2D animation tools

- Basic C# scripting

- You love dogs and care about animals



• Make sure to include your portfolio or Unity projects examples. If possible, briefly describe what you personally worked on in those projects.

title: Tour Operations Coordinator — Luxury Travel Company
description:
About Us



Female Foodie Tours is a luxury culinary travel company based in the USA. We run intimate, all-inclusive food tours across Italy for women — think handmade pasta in Tuscany, truffle hunting in Bologna, rooftop dinners in Rome. We're a small, tight-knit remote team that's growing fast (11 tours this year, 17 next year) and we take hospitality seriously. Our guests pay premium prices and expect a flawless experience.



Why This Role is Different



Most companies hiring remote coordinators hand you a mess and say "figure it out." Not us. We've built detailed systems, checklists, and templates for everything. Your job isn't to create the process — it's to own it, run it perfectly, and flag anything that needs attention. If you're the kind of person who loves checking every box and sleeping well knowing nothing slipped through the cracks, this role was made for you.

You'll work directly with our CEO and a small operations team. There's real ownership here — when a tour goes off without a hitch because every vendor showed up, every hotel was confirmed, and every detail landed, that's your win.



What You'll Do



Manage relationships with 30+ vendors across Italy (hotels, restaurants, guides, transport) — confirming bookings, sending reminders, and ensuring nothing falls through

Track tour preparation milestones and make sure every deadline is hit weeks before guests arrive

Coordinate vendor payments through our international payment platform

Arrange staff travel logistics (flights, accommodations) for tour hosts

Maintain our CRM with accurate, up-to-date vendor records

Identify backup vendors so we're never caught off guard



What Success Looks Like



Every vendor confirmed well before tour day — zero surprises

All preparation milestones completed on schedule

Payments set up accurately and on time

Clean, reliable data in our systems



What We're Looking For



2+ years of remote work experience

Excellent written English — you'll be
ing Italian vendors and communicating with a US-based team

Experience with CRM or project management tools (Airtable experience is a plus)

Someone who follows processes precisely and asks questions when something's unclear

Comfortable learning AI tools (we use Claude to help with drafting and research)

Reliable internet with a backup plan for outages



Bonus Points



Hospitality, travel, or events background

Experience working with European contacts or across time zones

Familiarity with international payment tools (Stripe, Airwallex, Wise)



Schedule

Full-time, 40 hours/week. Flexible within CET business hours (European time zone). We'll find a schedule that works for both sides.

Compensation



?60,000/month base salary

HMO healthcare coverage

Filipino Holidays and Paid time off

Quarterly performance bonus

Long-term role with a growing company — we're building a team, not hiring task workers



To Apply:



In your application message, start with the word "Confirmed" and answer the following three questions:



Describe a time you followed a detailed, multi-step process at work. How did you make sure nothing was missed?

Write a short, professional
 to a hotel in Italy confirming a group dinner reservation for 12 guests on March 15th. (Make it up — we want to see your tone and communication style.)

What's one question you have about this role?

title: E-commerce Accountant
description:
E-commerce Accountant (Finance/Ops)

Department: Finance & Operations

Reports To: CEO

Time Zone: Must overlap with U.S. CST

Location: Remote – Philippines

Salary: $1,300-$1,500 (more depends on lvl of exp)



Role Overview

A strategic yet hands-on finance and operations professional who will own the company’s financial visibility, bookkeeping accuracy, and reporting cadence.

This person bridges finance, data analysis, and operational execution — ensuring finance ops runs smoothly, profitably, and predictably as we scale.



The ideal candidate has strong accounting fundamentals, QuickBooks Online bookkeeping experience, and the ability to build automated dashboards and reports that drive clarity across departments.

Key Responsibilities

> Maintain and reconcile QuickBooks Online; ensure accurate bookkeeping and monthly close.



>Manage AR/AP, journal entries, and bank reconciliations.



> Prepare monthly reports on revenue, margin, and profit by channel (Retail, D2C, B2B).



>Conduct inventory accounting, including landed cost, duty, and freight allocation.



> Maintain the Pricing Master Sheet (MSRP, wholesale, and MAP tiers).





> Lead the 12-month rolling forecast, budgeting, and cash flow projections.



> Automate dashboards between QuickBooks, Shopify, and Google Sheets.



> Partner with Operations & Logistics on freight planning and inventory valuation.



> Support grant applications and compliance documentation with accurate financial data.



Requirements:

> 6+ years in accounting / bookkeeping, inventory accounting, and/or finance operations (retail or e-commerce preferred)

> QuickBooks Online bookkeeping (non-negotiable), bank reconciliations, AR/AP, and journal entries

> Advanced Excel/Google Sheets (pivot tables, dashboards, variance analysis), Shopify data exports, financial modeling

> Inventory accounting (FIFO, landed cost, freight allocation), COGS reconciliation, pricing & margin analysis

> Analytical, detail-oriented, and proactive communicator

> Must have prior graveyard-shift experience overlapping with U.S. CST



TO apply please answer the following questions: 



1) Describe your exact role in QuickBooks Online.

What did you personally own end-to-end (bank recs, journal entries, AR/AP, month-end close)?

How long did a typical monthly close take, and what reports did you deliver?



2) Walk us through how you’ve handled inventory accounting for an e-commerce business.



3) Have you produced profit or margin reports by channel (DTC, wholesale, retail, Amazon, B2B)?



4) Describe a 12-month rolling forecast you built or maintained.

What inputs did you own, how often was it updated, and how accurate was it versus actuals?



5) Give one concrete example of a dashboard or automation you built? (e.g., QuickBooks ? Shopify ? Google Sheets).

What problem did it solve, and what metrics did it surface?

Write a short, friendly
 to a guest named Sarah reminding her that we still need her passport scan — her tour is in 3 weeks and this is our second reminder. (Make it up — we want to see your tone.)

What's one question you have about this role?

title: VA Needed – Find B-Roll Footage for Short-Form Video Ads (Easy Task)
description:
I’m looking for a Virtual Assistant to help me find b-roll videos from the internet (stock sites, social media, etc.) based on scripts that I provide.



This is very simple and repetitive work.

No video editing required.

No voiceover.

No posting.



Your only task is to find suitable b-roll clips that visually match each line of the script.



What you’ll do:



Read a short script (usually 30–120 seconds)



Find matching b-roll clips for each scene



Organize links in Google Drive / Google Sheet



Label clips clearly (Scene 1, Scene 2, etc.)



Examples of b-roll needed:



Skincare close-ups



Before/after style shots



Product texture shots



People using beauty products



TikTok / UGC-style footage



Requirements:



Good visual sense (you understand what looks good on TikTok / Meta ads)



Can find b-roll from free or paid stock sites (I’ll tell you which)



Organized and detail-oriented



Basic English understanding is enough



Bonus (not required but good):



Experience with TikTok ads, UGC, or short-form video



Familiar with sites like Pexels, Pixabay, Mixkit, Storyblocks, Envato, etc.



Workload:



1 script = 10–30 b-roll clips



Multiple scripts per week if you do well



Long-term work available

title: Executive Assistant & Operations Coordinator (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote|Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: Senior Ecommerce Bookkeeper – End-to-End Ownership (QuickBooks Online) | Morning Schedule | Remote
description:
About Us

We are an Australian-based 7-figure ecommerce business seeking an experienced and dependable Bookkeeper to take full ownership of our bookkeeping function.



This role is for someone who understands end-to-end bookkeeping, works independently, and takes responsibility for accuracy. It is not suitable for candidates who have only handled narrow tasks such as accounts payable, accounts receivable, or data entry.



About the Role

You will be responsible for the complete bookkeeping function of the business using QuickBooks Online, within an automated ecommerce environment.



This role requires accuracy, accountability, and sound judgment. You will be trusted to maintain clean books, identify issues early, and resolve problems independently, without ongoing supervision.



Key Responsibilities

- End-to-end bookkeeping using QuickBooks Online

- Monthly reconciliations (bank accounts, credit cards, clearing accounts)

- BAS preparation

- Payroll processing

- Managing invoices and purchase orders

- Cash flow tracking and reporting

- Reviewing accounts regularly to identify and correct errors

- Ensuring accuracy and consistency across all financial records

- Working with ecommerce systems and integrations (WooCommerce)

- Improving bookkeeping and reporting processes where appropriate



What We are Looking for:

- Strong experience with QuickBooks Online or a comparable online accounting platform

- Experience supporting Australian businesses, including BAS, GST, and payroll

- Ecommerce bookkeeping experience or the ability to learn quickly

- High attention to detail and strong numerical skills

- Comfortable owning the full bookkeeping function independently

- Able to identify and resolve issues without constant guidance

- Comfortable working with automated systems and software integrations



Important

This role is not suitable for candidates who:

- Have only worked on isolated bookkeeping tasks

- Rely on others to diagnose or fix accounting issues

- Require step-by-step instructions for routine bookkeeping work



We are looking for someone who understands the broader financial picture, takes ownership of accuracy, and works proactively.



Working Hours

- 35 hours per week



Required availability:

- 7:00am – 9:00am AWST

- 3:00pm – 5:00pm AWST



Flexibility outside these windows to complete weekly hours



This role uses Time Doctor for time tracking, consistent with how our remote team operates. We focus on outcomes and accuracy, not micromanagement, and Time Doctor is used as a standard accountability and reporting tool.



What We Offer

- Stable, long-term employment

- Health insurance after six months

- Ongoing training and professional development

- Exposure to modern systems and automation

- Annual tea
etup in the Philippines

- Two weeks paid leave over Christmas and New Year, plus 13th-month pay

- Opportunity to grow into a more senior role over time



Why this role is different

You won’t be micromanaged. You’ll be trusted to:

- Own the books

- Keep things accurate

- Improve how we work

- Be part of a growing ecommerce business

- If you enjoy responsibility, learning, and building systems — this role will suit you well.



How to Apply:

Complete the initial screening form:

title: Illustrator and Print Designer
description:
We are seeking a creative and talented designer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for coming up with patterns for textile products and assisting in other projects such as packaging and illustrations for baby/maternity industry. The designer will be expected to work collaboratively with our team to produce high-quality designs and assist in other design projects as and when required.



Responsibilities:

• Concept & Trend Innovation: Conduct research into baby/children's market trends, then conceptualize and develop innovative print themes, color palettes, and design directions that resonate with our audience and align with KeaBabies' brand, leveraging • AI tools for accelerated ideation and visual exploration.

• Original Illustration: Create engaging, unique, and high-quality illustrations specifically tailored for KeaBabies' range of baby and children's products, such as swaddles, blankets, and bibs.

• Print & Pattern Design: Design seamless repeat patterns and distinctive print layouts for diverse product applications, ensuring all designs are optimized for manufacturing processes.

• Packaging Design: Assist in developing compelling and functional packaging designs that are on-brand, protect the product, and significantly enhance the overall customer experience.

• Production Readiness & Quality: Ensure all designs are production-ready and technically sound, meeting high-quality standards. This includes preparing accurate files and maintaining organized project records.

• Market Insight & Adaptation: Continuously monitor industry trends, competitor designs, and consumer preferences within the baby/children's market to directly inform and elevate design decisions.



Job Details:

• Salary: USD 450 to USD 600 per month

• Working Hours: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM (GMT+8)

• Working Days: Monday to Friday



Requirements:

• A Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Illustration, or a related field.

• Portfolio: A strong, diverse, and professional online portfolio is mandatory. It must clearly showcase exceptional illustration skills, a deep understanding of color theory, and the ability to create seamless repeat patterns. Examples relevant to the baby and children's product industry are highly preferred.

• Industry Knowledge: A deep understanding of current design trends, consumer preferences, and aesthetic styles within the baby and children's product market.

• Software Proficiency: Expertise in digital design software, including Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, and Procreate, along with other relevant illustration and design tools. Familiarity with and willingness to explore AI-powered design tools is highly valued.

• Communication & Collaboration: Excellent project management and communication skills. You should have a proven ability to work collaboratively with the team, clearly articulating design concepts and feedback.

• Adaptability: A demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment while maintaining high-quality output. This role requires you to be highly self-motivated, organized, and disciplined to manage projects and meet deadlines independently.



Take note of the following:

• Title your message: "I want to be your next Illustrator and Print Designer!"

• Share with us your experience on marketing print design and illustrations.

• Attach your resume and sample task answers in the
.

• No moonlighting is allowed during work hours in this role.

title: Remote Web Developer & Webmaster (Multi-Site Website Operations)
description:
Remote Web Developer & Webmaster (Multi-Site Website Operations) ($4.00/hr Trial) $4.25–$4.75/hr After, Depending on Skill and Performance)



We are building a clean, scalable website operations system across multiple business brands and domains, and we are looking for a sharp, reliable operator who can help build and manage multiple websites, publish monthly blog content, and document workflows without needing constant oversight.



This is not a one-off freelance gig. This is a long-term operational role for someone who can become the go-to person responsible for maintaining and scaling a growing portfolio of websites under one organization.



All websites will be developed and managed inside our own private cloud network environment. Basic SSH comfort is strongly preferred for simple file-based website workflows.



All business details, domains, and workflows will be shared after signing an NDA and hiring.





What You’ll Be Doing (Examples Only – Not Limited To):

• Build and maintain multiple business websites with consistent formatting and structure

• Publish SEO-friendly blog content across several sites each month (recurring monthly posting is required)

• Format pages correctly (headings, spacing, internal links, basic SEO structure)

• Work inside a private hosted environment when needed (SSH familiarity is a strong plus)

• Create checklists and SOPs so the work is repeatable and replaceable

• Keep website operations organized long-term as we scale

• Provide weekly progress updates and flag blockers immediately





You’re a Good Fit If:

• You can work independently and figure things out

• You write clearly and professionally in English

• You have experience building and managing multiple websites long-term

• You are consistent with recurring monthly blog deliverables

• You have experience with website platforms or static site workflows (WordPress, Wix, Webflow, or similar)

• You are comfortable in structured backend environments (SSH is a plus)

• Basic HTML/CSS knowledge is a strong plus

• You are organized and process-driven (documentation matters here)

• You want long-term growth and loyalty inside one operation





Privacy & NDA Terms:

• A signed NDA is required before accessing anything

• This is a non-client-facing internal role

• You’ll be trusted with private operational information — discretion is mandatory

• No third-party agencies or subcontracting





Minimum Requirements – Do Not Apply If:

• You are working multiple VA jobs or plan to split focus

• You cannot commit consistently each week

• You need constant check-ins or detailed walkthroughs for basic tasks

• You are not willing to work long-term or want a side gig

• You’re part of an agency or manage other clients





Pay & Commitment:

• $4.00/hr to start (30-day trial period)

• Rate increases to $4.25–$4.75/hr after the trial depending on skill and performance

• Paid weekly to begin, then bi-weekly

• Long-term only, NOT open to short-term contractors





Schedule:

• Initial setup phase: 15–20 hours/week (first month)

• Ongoing maintenance: 5–8 hours/week long-term

• Work must be completed during our operating hours: 9:00 AM – 2:00 PM Pacific Time (PST)

• More hours available as the website portfolio grows





HOW TO APPLY:



Copy and paste this on your reply:

“Web Developer/Webmaster – [Your First Name]”



Include:



A short intro

Your weekly availability + timezone

Confirmation you can work within 9:00 AM – 2:00 PM PST

Confirmation you’re okay with the rate + NDA

Examples of websites or blogs you have built or maintained long-term

One example of how you helped a business stay organized or scale recurring website operations





If you’re consistent, organized, and ready to grow into a long-term operational role, let’s move fast and build.



Blue River Management

title: Creative Strategist – Paid Ads (E-Commerce, Performance Focused)
description:
CarMe is a fast-growing e-commerce brand and one of the market leaders in the Netherlands and Belgium in automotive accessories such as CarPlay screens, dongles, and smart car tech. Our goal is simple: build a strong, scalable DTC brand while maintaining performance-driven growth.



We are looking for a Creative Strategist who understands what makes ads convert. Your job is to think, structure, and d
 what creatives should be made, based on data, testing, and performance insights.



You will work closely with our editors, UGC creators, ads managers, and website team to continuously improve ad performance and scale winning concepts.



WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

- Developing ad concepts and creative strategies for Meta, Google, and other paid channels

- Writing hooks, angles, and script outlines for video and static ads

- Translating performance data into new creative ideas and iterations

- D
 what to test next and why (creative testing roadmap)

- Creating clear briefs for video editors and UGC creators

- Reviewing ad performance and identifying winning patterns

- Working closely with the ads managers to align creatives with campaign goals

- Collaborating with the website team to align ads with landing pages and funnels



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

- Proven experience as a creative strategist, performance marketer, or similar role

- Strong understanding of paid ads (Meta Ads experience required)

- Experience in e-commerce or DTC brands

- Ability to think in hooks, angles, offers, and conversion psychology

- Data-driven mindset (you understand ROAS, CPA, AOV, testing logic)

- Clear communication skills in English

- Structured, proactive, and comfortable taking ownership



WHAT WE OFFER

- Remote role in a fast-growing international e-commerce brand

- Direct impact on ad performance and company growth

- Freedom to test ideas and build scalable creative systems

- Long-term collaboration if there is a strong match

- Competitive compensation based on experience and performance



READY TO JOIN US?

Send us your CV and a short motivation explaining how you think about winning ad creatives.

To make sure you’ve read the full job post, please include the word “watermelon” in your application.

title: CPA Accountant
description:
We are seeking a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) to join our organisation under an exclusive arrangement. Please note that this position is not open to freelancers, contractors, or companies.

 

The successful candidate must have:

  • A suitable work environment

  • Reliable internet connection

  • A work PC or laptop

  • Willingness to screen share due to the sensitive nature of the work

 

Main Duties

  • Bookkeeping / Bank Reconciliation

  • Preparing Tax / VAT Returns

  • Preparing Financial Accounts

  • Payroll / Pension

 

Responsibilities

  • Record day-to-day financial transactions and complete the posting process

  • Verify that transactions are recorded in the correct ledgers (day book, suppliers, customers, general ledger)

  • Bring the books to the trial balance stage

  • Perform partial checks of the posting process

  • Bank reconciliation

  • Complete tax returns and prepare VAT returns

  • Enter data, maintain records, and prepare reports and financial statements

  • Process accounts receivable/payable and handle payroll in a timely manner

  • Provide administrative and clerical support as needed

  • Perform additional bookkeeping duties as designated by management

 

Education & Experience

  • Proven bookkeeping experience

  • Solid understanding of bookkeeping principles

  • Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles and procedures

  • Working knowledge of relevant computer applications, spreadsheets, and accounting software (preferably Xero Accounting & QuickBooks – training can be provided)

  • Knowledge of data management and financial data analysis

 

Key Competencies

  • Planning and organising

  • Strong mathematical skills (basic arithmetic essential)

  • High degree of accuracy and attention to detail

  • Information collection and monitoring

  • Problem analysis and problem solving

  • Proficiency in English and MS Office

  • Strong communication and customer service skills

  • Confidentiality and discretion with sensitive financial information

  • Integrity

 

Benefits

  • Opportunities for promotion

  • Pathway to permanent employment

  • Work from home arrangement

  • Medical cover (upon permanent employment)

  • 22 days Paid Leave, including National (Regular) Holidays

 

Schedule

  • Fixed 8-hour shift

  • Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM London Time (with 1-hour unpaid break)

 

Compensation

  • Php 30,000.00 during probation

  • Increased to Php 40,000.00 after probation

  • Increased to Php 50,000.00 after 6-month review 

  • 13th month bonus

 

Application Requirements

 Candidates should confirm the following in their application:

  • Comfort with the working hours stated above

  • Availability to commence from a specific date

  • Current working status

  • Attach a copy of their Resume

title: Amazon Brand Manager
description:
Manage daily sales operations for assigned products, including pricing, promotions, and advertising campaigns (PPC required).

Oversee existing product listings and identify new revenue opportunities within respective categories.

Monitor product performance to ensure consistent sales growth and higher product category rankings.

Conduct in-depth product analysis to identify and address performance issues and enhance the customer experience.

Research market trends and competitors to uncover new opportunities and guide strategic decisions.

Collaborate with the inventory planning team to plan and promote excess inventory through effective promotional activities.

Ensure accuracy, timeliness, and confidentiality in all deliverables and data handling.

Provide regular updates and feedback to supervisors on progress, challenges, and opportunities.

Comply with all Company policies, procedures, and quality standards.

Perform other related duties as assigned.





Qualifications



Strong analytical background

Ability to make informed, quick, and calculated decisions based on large amount of data whether launching new products or updating current products

Highly efficient in time and task management

Has an entrepreneurial mind-set

title: Amazon Compliance Specialist
description:
Conduct in-depth research on FDA, EPA, FTC, and other relevant federal and state regulations.

Ensure compliance with international product safety standards (EU, UK, Canada, Asia-Pacific) when applicable.

Perform ongoing monitoring of regulatory updates and interpret implications for product categories.

Support intellectual property due diligence to prevent patent, copyright, or trademark infringement.



Risk Management & Product Compliance



Evaluate new and existing products for compliance risks and advise stakeholders on mitigation strategies.

Develop compliance testing protocols and coordinate with third-party labs and certification agencies.

Manage corrective actions, recalls, or withdrawals in alignment with Amazon’s policies and legal requirements.

Conduct audits of product listings and seller submissions to prevent unlawful or restricted product selection.



Cross-Functional Collaboration



Partner with Legal, Product Development, Supply Chain, and Seller Performance teams to execute compliance initiatives.

Provide clear guidance to vendors, suppliers, and internal teams on compliance requirements.

Train cross-functional stakeholders on compliance best practices and emerging regulatory risks.

Act as a subject matter expert to business teams during product launches, regulatory reviews, and inspections.



Policy & Process Development



Draft and implement compliance procedures, standard operating protocols (SOPs), and escalation processes.

Support automation and system-based compliance controls to scale monitoring and enforcement.

Contribute to internal policy development regarding restricted products, product claims, and safety certifications.

Continuously improve workflows to enhance accuracy, timeliness, and audit readiness.



Documentation & Reporting



Maintain accurate records of compliance assessments, approvals, and regulatory correspondence.

Prepare detailed reports and risk assessments for leadership review.

Provide supervisors with regular feedback on task progress, emerging risks, and resolution status.

Ensure confidentiality of sensitive data, supplier information, and Amazon business strategy.





Experience interacting directly with regulators including federal and state agencies

Experience in research and analyzing federal and state regulations

Familiarity and experience in dealing with FDA regulation is REQUIRED

Familiarity with international compliance frameworks (REACH, RoHS, CE marking).

Experience in compliance auditing, regulatory affairs, or legal review.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

Excellent communication skills for engaging with global teams and regulators.

Ability to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with strict deadline

title: Mobile App Developer (iOS & Android)
description:
About MSTR



MSTR (
) is a specialized AI software company based in the Netherlands. We build custom AI-driven solutions that transform how businesses work – making them more productive, data-driven, and intelligent.



We're not just building software; we're pushing the boundaries of what's possible with AI technology. From proof-of-concept to production-ready applications, we deliver end-to-end solutions that make a real impact.



This is a Long-Term Career Opportunity



We're looking for developers who want to build a long-term career with us, not just find their next gig. We invest in our tea
mbers' growth, provide ongoing learning opportunities, and increase responsibility as you develop.



If you're seeking long-term stability, continuous learning, and the chance to work on cutting-edge AI projects, keep reading.



Location & Type:

- Remote (work from anywhere in the Philippines)

- Full-time (40 hours/week)

- Long-term contractor position



What you'll do



- Build and maintain features for our iOS and/or Android apps.

- Own the full release flow: signing, testing, and publishing to the App Store or Google Play.

- Implement and improve audio recording features including background capture, segmentation, and interruption handling.

- Integrate with Azure cloud services (Blob Storage uploads, SAS token workflows) and consume our Python/FastAPI backend APIs.

- Use AI-assisted tools (Claude Code, Cursor) to streamline coding, automate repetitive tasks, and improve code quality.

- Participate in code reviews, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement of processes.



What we're looking for



Must-have:

- Solid production experience in Swift (iOS) and/or Kotlin (Android)

- Experience with UIKit (iOS) or Android components (Fragments, lifecycle, AndroidX)

- Track record of deploying apps to the App Store and/or Google Play

- Experience with RxSwift / RxJava or similar reactive programming

- OAuth 2.0 / MSAL or enterprise SSO integration (PKCE, token refresh, multi-provider)

- Background processing - URLSession background transfers (iOS) or Foreground Services (Android)



Nice-to-have:

- Audio recording with native APIs (AVFoundation / MediaRecorder)

- Realm database with encryption and migrations

- Dagger 2 dependency injection with custom scopes (Android)

- SwiftUI (iOS)

- Coordinator pattern, MVVM (iOS)

- CI/CD (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Gradle), Git workflows, code reviews

- Performance profiling and crash analytics (Sentry)

- Azure Blob Storage SDK integration

- WidgetKit / Live Activities (iOS), Material Components (Android)

- Familiarity with AI-assisted development workflows using Claude Code or Cursor

- Full-stack experience with Python (FastAPI) and React (TypeScript) is a strong plus, enabling contributions to backend and web projects when app development cycles are lighter



Soft skills:

- Strong communication and collaboration skills

- Problem-solving mindset and attention to detail

- Adaptability to changing requirements or new technologies

- Ability to take ownership of tasks and deliver results independently

- Enthusiasm for learning and sharing knowledge with the team



Stacks:

iOS: Swift, UIKit, SwiftUI, RxSwift/RxCocoa, Moya, Alamofire, RealmSwift, CryptoKit (AES-GCM), Sentry, CocoaPods, R.swift, Widget Extension (Live Activities)

Android: Kotlin, RxJava 3, Retrofit + OkHttp, Dagger 2, Realm, Gson, MSAL (OAuth 2.0), Azure Blob Storage SDK, Navigation Component (Safe Args), Encrypted SharedPreferences, Sentry, Lottie, Timber



Most Important:

We value potential and enthusiasm just as much as current technical skills. A driven junior developer with a strong foundation and hunger to learn is more valuable to us than an experienced developer without long-term commitment.



What We Offer:

- Competitive compensation and benefits

- Flexible remote work – work from anywhere in the Philippines

- Long-term partnership – we're investing in your long-term future with us

- Continuous learning – work with cutting-edge AI technology, modern tech stack

- Freedom to innovate – propose solutions, choose appropriate technologies

- Collaborative team – work with passionate, talented people

- Career growth – increasing responsibility and challenges as you develop

- Meaningful work – build applications that genuinely help businesses transform



How to Apply



IMPORTANT: We assess candidates primarily through video responses. Please DO NOT apply without submitting a video.



Step 1: Create a Short Video (3-7 minutes)



Record yourself answering these 5 questions:



1. Tell us about yourself: Briefly introduce yourself and your journey as a developer.



2. Your technical skills: What are your key technical skills? Describe a challenging project you've worked on and how you solved it.



3. AI and technology: What interests you about working with AI technologies? Why does this excite you?



4. Learning approach: How do you approach learning new technologies? Give us a recent example.



5. Your next role: What would you like to achieve in your next role? Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?



Video Guidelines:

- Length: 3-7 minutes total

- Production: No need for professional quality – we want to see the real you

- Authenticity: Share your own thoughts and personality—please do NOT read a ChatGPT-generated script because we notice immediately

- Language: English (this assesses your communication skills)

- Format: Any video format is fine (MP4, MOV, etc.)

- Hosting: Upload to Google Drive, Dropbox, YouTube (unlisted), or similar



Step 2: Submit Your Application

Send the following to 

1. Your video (link or attachment)

2. Your CV/Resume

3. Optional: Portfolio, GitHub profile, LinkedIn profile, or work samples



 Subject Line: "Mobile App Developer Application - [Your Name]"



What Happens Next:

1. We'll review your video and CV within 2-3 days

2. If you're a strong match, we'll schedule an initial interview

3. Successful candidates move to technical evaluation

4. Final candidates meet with our founder

5. We aim to complete the entire process in 1-2 weeks



Who Should Apply

Apply if you:

- Want a long-term career in a high-performance organization

- Are excited about AI and modern technology

- Value continuous learning and growth

- Communicate well in English

- Are driven, reliable, and proactive

- Want to build meaningful applications



Don't apply if you:

- Only want short-term gigs or are juggling multiple clients

- Aren't willing to create a video response

- Don't have foundational full-stack skills

- Aren't interested in long-term commitment



About Our Team



We're building a diverse, talented team of developers who are passionate about AI and technology. We value:

- Quality over quantity – we hire carefully and invest in our people

- Long-term thinking – every hire is for the next 10 years

- Continuous learning – technology evolves, and so do we

- Collaboration – we win together

- Impact – build things that matter



Ready to Apply?



If you're excited about this opportunity and ready to build a long-term career with MSTR, we'd love to hear from you!



Send your video and CV to: 



We look forward to learning more about you!



MSTR – Building the Future with AI

title: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant

Reports To:  CEO

Work Hours:  Philippines daytime work hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field.  We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact.  You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.  

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides.  Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products.  We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

That’s where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

Own, track, and optimize every cost that impacts Amazon unit economics, so leadership always has a clear, accurate, and optimized view of true ASIN-level profitability.



What Success Looks Like:

Success in this role means true Amazon profitability is no longer a guessing game. Every ASIN has a fully loaded cost that includes product cost, shipping, duties, Amazon fees, affiliate commissions, and ranking-related marketing spend. Leadership can confidently d
 which products to scale, reprice, suppress, liquidate, or discontinue based on real data — not blended averages or assumptions.



A top performer in this role consistently reduces total Amazon unit costs while improving cost visibility. Through tight auditing, proactive fee recovery, smarter shipping and duty tracking, and disciplined attribution of affiliate and ranking spend, this role directly increases contribution margin without increasing ad spend or revenue risk.



Primary Objectives

•  Amazon Fee, Shipping & Cost Auditing

Own end-to-end auditing of all Amazon, logistics, and ranking-related costs.

•  Fully Loaded ASIN-Level Unit Economics

Maintain accurate per-unit costs including shipping, duties, fees, affiliates, and marketing.

•  Cost Optimization & Reduction

Identify and implement cost-saving opportunities across fees, logistics, and promotional spend.

•  Profitability & Decision Support

Provide leadership with clean, reliable Amazon cost and margin reporting.  



Regular Work Activities

•  Audit all Amazon FBA fees (pick/pack, weight, storage, returns)

•  Track short-term and long-term storage fees by ASIN

•  Monitor aged inventory fees and cost exposure

•  Track AWD inbound, storage, and handling fees

•  Reconcile inbound placement fees

•  Track removal, disposal, and liquidation costs

•  Track international shipping costs (factory ? port ? Amazon)

•  Allocate shipping cost per unit by shipment and ASIN

•  Track duties, tariffs, customs, and brokerage fees

•  Maintain landed cost per unit calculations

•  Track affiliate commissions tied to Amazon sales

•  Attribute affiliate spend at ASIN or product-group level

•  Track ranking, launch, and promotional marketing costs

•  Identify unprofitable or fee-heavy SKUs

•  Submit and track Amazon reimbursement claims

•  Create monthly Amazon cost & margin reports

•  Monitor fee and cost trend anomalies

•  Maintain SOPs for Amazon cost tracking and audits



Key Skills Required

•  Understanding & ability to learn Amazon FBA fee structures

•  Strong grasp of landed cost accounting

•  Advanced spreadsheet skills

•  Experience with SKU-level profitability modeling

•  Strong analytical and investigative mindset

•  High attention to detail

•  Ability to reconcile complex datasets

•  Process-driven 

•  Cost-reduction oriented thinking

•  Clear written & verbal communication



People Contacts and Interactions – What are the primary people contacts in this job (who, why, and how often)?

•  Direct report to the CEO

•  Frequent communication with

• Operations Team

• Logistics Team



Role Requirements

Experience, Training, and Education 

•  2+ years working with Amazon Seller Central data

•  Experience tracking shipping, duties, and landed costs

•  Familiarity with FBA, AWD, and storage fee structures

•  Advanced spreadsheet proficiency required

•  E-commerce or marketplace finance experience preferred

•  Experience submitting Amazon reimbursement claims preferred

•  Comfortable owning ASIN-level economics end-to-end

•  Strong personal accountability

•  Not responsible for tax, payroll, AR/AP, or general bookkeeping     



How to Apply:

Click the link - 

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Amazon SEO Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon SEO Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Operations Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field.  We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact.  You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.  

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides.  Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products.  We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

That’s where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

The Amazon SEO Manager owns the organic discoverability and conversion performance of our Amazon catalog by building and executing a disciplined SEO system. This role ensures our listings are consistently optimized with the right keywords, content, and structure, so we rank higher, earn more organic traffic, and convert more shoppers - reducing reliance on paid ads over time.



This person translates keyword research, search query data, and competitor insights into prioritized listing actions (titles, bullets, backend terms, images, A+ content), and ensures SEO work is delivered on a reliable cadence aligned with seasonality, pricing strategy, and key retail events.



What Success Looks Like

A successful Amazon SEO Manager consistently increases organic visibility and conversion by keeping keyword strategy, listings, and metadata current and intentional. This person owns the SEO engine that compounds: better indexing, better rankings, higher CTR, higher CVR, and a stronger organic share of sales—without sacrificing brand quality or compliance.

They run a disciplined cadence of keyword research and refresh, systematically improve listings (titles/bullets/A+/images/backend), and translate data (DR/DD/SQP/SI) into prioritized action. They partner closely with PPC and creative to ensure keyword targets, positioning, and content work together—especially during seasonality, deal events, and pricing shifts.



ONE THING: Drive organic ranking, discoverability, and conversion through consistent keyword research, listing optimization, and SEO execution.



Primary Objectives

• Keyword Research & Keyword Refresh System

• Listing Optimization That Moves CTR + CVR

• SEO + Pricing + Event Alignment

• Competitive Advantage



Regular Work Activities

• Organize and refresh keyword sets (roots + long-tails)

• Identify indexing/ranking opportunities; improve keyword organization and tracking

• Update keyword clusters for PPC alignment and indexing strategy

• Maintain MKL setup/expansion and competitor set updates

• Update Data Rova + Data Dive projects (add ASINs, add keywords, track)

• General Listing Optimization (Images, Title, Bullets, A+ Content)

• Daily spot checks on priority ASINs

• Weekly analysis and seasonal updates

• Maintain seasonal/event folders + flat files for themed updates

• Update keyword focus on listings based on performance and ranking goals

• Price Strategy Support (PED, BD, STP, BTP)

• Weekly/as-needed price strategy collaboration

• STP action reviews after reports; implement improvements tied to velocity + CVR

• Ensure consistent lowest 30D price logic where required

• Support deal site strategy when applicable (drive off-Amazon traffic into deals)

• SQP/SI review weekly/as needed; identify actions and implement

• Competitor analysis weekly/as needed (price/listing/keywords/PPC targets)

• Manage Experiments monthly/as needed (title/image/A+ testing)

• Product classification review monthly (category alignment, item type)

• FAQ seeding weekly/as needed

• Target: 30+ FAQs added per month (based on ASIN priority list)

• Special projects as assigned by leadership (catalog cleanups, large refreshes, launches)

• Emergency fixes (suppressed listings, indexing drops, attribute issues)

• Weekly SEO/Optimization sync (priority list + actions + blockers)

• Weekly PPC alignment (keyword harvesting + targeting coordination)

• Weekly creative coordination (assets needed, deadlines, tests)



Key Skills

• Amazon SEO strategy + execution (keyword research, indexing, rank growth)

• Strong copy + conversion thinking (CTR/CVR-focused content decisions)

• Data literacy (SQP/SI/keyword tools) and action orientation

• Organized project management across many ASINs

• Experimentation mindset (testing, learning, iterating)
